title: Will a candidate from the Democratic Party win the US presidential election in 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate from the Democratic Party is officially declared the winner of the 2028 United States presidential election. The winner must be confirmed by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or another official government body responsible for certifying the election results. In the event of a dispute or recount, the resolution will be based on the final certified result. If the election is not decided by December 31, 2028, the resolution date will be extended until an official winner is declared.

title: Will Joe Biden run for re-election in 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden officially declares his candidacy for the 2028 United States presidential election. The official declaration must be made through a public announcement or filing with the Federal Election Commission (FEC). In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming his candidacy will suffice. If Joe Biden steps down, passes away, or otherwise becomes incapable of running before making an official declaration, this question resolves as No.

title: Will Joe Biden's administration implement new federal regulations on artificial intelligence by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the Biden administration implements new federal regulations specifically targeting artificial intelligence (AI) technologies. 

The regulations must be officially enacted and published in the Federal Register. 

The regulations must address AI technologies directly, including but not limited to machine learning, neural networks, or other forms of AI. 

General technology regulations that do not specifically mention AI do not count towards this question's resolution. 

The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from a relevant federal agency (e.g., the Department of Commerce, the Federal Trade Commission) or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian).

title: Will the Republican Party win the US presidential election in 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Republican Party candidate is officially declared the winner of the 2028 United States presidential election.

The official declaration must come from the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or another authoritative government body responsible for certifying the election results. In the absence of an official declaration, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice.

In the event of legal disputes or recounts, the resolution will be based on the final certified result as of the resolution date. If the election is not decided by the resolution date, the question will remain unresolved until an official winner is declared.

title: Will California implement a new voting system for state elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, California officially implements a new voting system for state elections. A 'new voting system' is defined as any significant change to the method by which votes are cast or counted, including but not limited to: the introduction of ranked-choice voting, proportional representation, or the use of blockchain technology for vote recording.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from California's Secretary of State or through the passage of relevant state legislation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (such as the Los Angeles Times, San Francisco Chronicle, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The new system must be operational and used in at least one state election. Pilot programs or trials do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Donald Trump run for the US presidency again by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Donald J. Trump officially files to run for the office of President of the United States in any presidential election held on or before December 31, 2027. 

The filing must be with the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or another appropriate official body that oversees the election process. 

The question resolves as No if no such filing is made by the resolution date. 

In the event of ambiguity or dispute, confirmation from at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be used to resolve the question.

title: Will Iran and the United States re-establish formal diplomatic relations by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Iran and the United States have officially re-established formal diplomatic relations. This is defined as the mutual establishment of embassies or consulates in each other's capitals, or the appointment of ambassadors. Confirmation must come from official government announcements from both Iran and the United States. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary or provisional diplomatic missions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will any additional countries leave the European Union before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, any country that is a member of the European Union as of January 1, 2023, officially completes the legal process to leave the European Union.

The departure must be confirmed by an official announcement from both the departing country's government and the European Union. Credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are also sufficient for confirmation.

The resolution will be based on the date the departure is legally finalized, not the date of the announcement or referendum. If no country leaves the European Union by the specified date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will Sweden's investment in renewable energy result in a 50% reduction in carbon emissions by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Sweden's carbon emissions are reduced by 50% compared to the baseline year of 1990.

The reduction must be confirmed by official statistics from Sweden's Environmental Protection Agency (Naturvårdsverket) or a similar authoritative body. In the absence of such official confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The reduction must be in total national carbon emissions, not per capita or sector-specific reductions. Temporary reductions due to extraordinary events (such as natural disasters or pandemics) will not count towards this question's resolution. The measurement must reflect a sustained reduction over the year 2028.

title: Will the United Kingdom hold a national referendum on electoral reform by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom holds a national referendum specifically on the issue of electoral reform. "Electoral reform" is defined as changes to the voting system used to elect members of Parliament, such as moving from 'First Past the Post' to a proportional representation system. The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the UK government and open to all eligible voters. The holding of the referendum must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The question resolves as NO if no such referendum is held by the resolution date, or if the referendum is held on a different issue.

title: Will North Korea conduct a national election that is recognized as free and fair by international observers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, North Korea conducts a national election that is recognized as free and fair by international observers. The criteria for recognition are as follows:

- The election must be monitored by at least three reputable international organizations, such as the United Nations, the Carter Center, or the European Union.
- These organizations must release a public report stating that the election was conducted in a free and fair manner, without significant irregularities, voter suppression, or coercion.
- The election must include genuine political competition, with multiple candidates or parties allowed to participate without undue restrictions.
- The election process must be transparent, and the results must be publicly announced and verified by the monitoring organizations.

If any of these criteria are not met, the question will resolve as No. In the event of conflicting reports from the monitoring organizations, the question will resolve based on the majority consensus.

title: Will the Chancellor of Germany be from the Green Party after the 2028 federal election?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, following the 2028 federal election in Germany, a member of the Alliance 90/The Greens (Bündnis 90/Die Grünen) is officially appointed as the Chancellor of Germany.
The appointment must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Bundestag or the Federal President of Germany.
If the Chancellor resigns or is replaced before the end of the term, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the initial appointment was from the Green Party.
In case of a coalition government, the question resolves as Yes only if the Chancellor is a member of the Green Party, regardless of the coalition's composition.
Credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient to confirm the appointment.

title: Will the Republican Party win the majority in the U.S. Senate in the 2028 elections?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Republican Party wins at least 51 seats in the U.S. Senate as a result of the 2028 elections. The count of seats will be based on the official results reported by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or an equivalent authoritative source. If there are any legal disputes or recounts, the resolution will be based on the final certified results. In the event of a 50-50 split with the Vice President being Republican, this question will still resolve as No, as the Vice President's tie-breaking vote does not count towards the majority of seats.

title: Will AI-driven diagnostics become the standard in medicine by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven diagnostics become the standard practice in at least one of the following areas of medicine:

- Radiology: AI systems are used to interpret medical images (e.g., X-rays, MRIs) in at least 50% of hospitals and clinics.
- Pathology: AI systems are used to analyze tissue samples and diagnose diseases in at least 50% of hospitals and clinics.
- General Diagnostics: AI systems are used for initial patient assessments and diagnostic recommendations in at least 50% of primary care practices.

The adoption must be confirmed by official statements from relevant medical authorities (such as the American Medical Association or the National Health Service) or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

The AI systems must be operational and not in a trial phase. The question resolves as NO if AI-driven diagnostics are not adopted as standard practice in any of the specified areas by the resolution date.

title: Will AI be used to predict NBA game outcomes with over 90% accuracy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system is demonstrated to predict NBA game outcomes with an accuracy rate of over 90%. The AI system must meet the following criteria:

- The predictions must cover at least one full NBA season (regular season and playoffs).
- The accuracy rate is calculated as the number of correctly predicted game outcomes divided by the total number of games in the season, expressed as a percentage.
- The AI system must be publicly documented, with its methodology and results published in a peer-reviewed journal or presented at a major AI or sports analytics conference.
- Independent verification of the AI system's accuracy rate must be provided by at least two reputable sources, such as academic institutions, major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, The New York Times, BBC), or recognized sports analytics organizations.

In the event of multiple AI systems claiming to achieve this accuracy rate, the first to meet all criteria will be considered for resolution. If no AI system meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will AI-driven analytics become a standard tool for MLB team strategies by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven analytics are widely adopted and used as a standard tool for team strategies in Major League Baseball (MLB).

"AI-driven analytics" refers to the use of machine learning models, neural networks, or other artificial intelligence techniques to analyze player performance, game strategies, and other relevant data to inform decision-making during games and across seasons.

"Standard tool" means that at least 20 out of the 30 MLB teams publicly acknowledge the use of AI-driven analytics as a routine part of their strategy formulation and decision-making processes.

Confirmation of this adoption must come from official team statements, press releases, or credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic).

In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the majority consensus of the sources.

title: Will Google develop an AI that can accurately predict natural disasters by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google develops an artificial intelligence system that meets the following criteria for accurately predicting natural disasters:

- The AI system must be able to predict at least three types of natural disasters (e.g., earthquakes, hurricanes, floods) with a minimum accuracy rate of 85%.
- Predictions must be made at least 48 hours in advance of the event.
- The system's predictions must be verified by at least two independent scientific organizations or agencies specializing in natural disaster research (e.g., USGS, NOAA, WMO).
- The AI system must be publicly demonstrated and documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.

The question resolves as Yes upon the first official announcement and verification of the AI system meeting these criteria. If no such system is developed and verified by the resolution date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will an AI-driven basketball analytics system be widely adopted in the NBA by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI-driven basketball analytics system is widely adopted in the NBA. 

For the purposes of this question, "widely adopted" means that at least 20 out of the 30 NBA teams are using such a system during the regular season for player performance analysis, game strategy, or other significant basketball-related decisions.

An "AI-driven basketball analytics system" is defined as a software or hardware system that utilizes artificial intelligence techniques such as machine learning, deep learning, or neural networks to analyze basketball-related data.

The adoption must be confirmed by at least three credible sources, which may include major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) or official announcements from NBA teams or the NBA itself. 

If there is any ambiguity regarding the adoption status, the question will resolve based on the consensus of reports from these sources.

title: Will the United Nations adopt a global framework for AI ethics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations officially adopts a global framework specifically addressing AI ethics. The framework must be a formal document that outlines principles, guidelines, or standards for ethical AI development and deployment.

The adoption must be confirmed by an official announcement from the United Nations or its relevant bodies, such as the General Assembly or the Secretary-General. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The framework must be intended for global application and not limited to specific regions or countries. Drafts, proposals, or documents under discussion do not count towards this question's resolution. The framework must be formally adopted and recognized as an official UN document.

title: Will the value of the US dollar in cryptocurrency markets significantly increase by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the value of the US dollar (USD) in cryptocurrency markets increases significantly, defined as a minimum of 25% increase in value against a basket of major cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Litecoin). The value will be determined by the average closing price of the USD against these cryptocurrencies over the last 30 days of 2027, compared to the average closing price over the last 30 days of 2026.

The data must be sourced from at least three reputable cryptocurrency exchange platforms (e.g., Coinbase, Binance, Kraken). If there is a significant discrepancy between the platforms, the median value will be used. In the event of major regulatory changes or market disruptions that invalidate the comparison, the question will resolve as N/A.

title: Will Microsoft release a general-purpose AI that surpasses human performance in most tasks by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Microsoft releases a general-purpose artificial intelligence (AI) system that surpasses human performance in a majority of tasks. 

"General-purpose AI" is defined as an AI system capable of performing a wide range of tasks across different domains, rather than being specialized for a single task. 

"Surpasses human performance" means that the AI system demonstrates performance superior to that of an average human in at least 70% of the tasks it is tested on, where tasks are representative of a broad spectrum of human activities including, but not limited to, language understanding, problem-solving, creativity, and physical tasks.

The performance of the AI must be verified by independent experts and documented in a peer-reviewed publication or confirmed by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will an AI system be able to predict the outcome of a baseball season with over 90% accuracy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system successfully predicts the outcome of a Major League Baseball (MLB) season with over 90% accuracy. The prediction must include the following outcomes:
- Division winners for both the American League and National League.
- Teams that qualify for the playoffs.
- The winner of the World Series.

The AI system must make its predictions before the start of the MLB season and must be publicly documented. The accuracy of the predictions will be verified against the actual outcomes of the MLB season.

The AI system's predictions must be documented in a reputable source, such as a peer-reviewed journal, a major news organization (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian), or an official MLB announcement. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, Fox Sports) are sufficient.

If the AI system's predictions are found to be over 90% accurate according to the criteria above, the question will resolve as Yes. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

title: Will Benjamin Netanyahu remain the Prime Minister of Israel until the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Benjamin Netanyahu remains the Prime Minister of Israel until the end of December 31, 2028, according to official records from the Israeli government.

If Benjamin Netanyahu resigns, is removed from office, or otherwise leaves the position of Prime Minister before the end of December 31, 2028, the question will resolve as No.

Temporary absences or periods where Netanyahu is unable to perform his duties but does not officially leave office (e.g., due to illness) will not affect the resolution of this question. However, if an acting Prime Minister is officially appointed and Netanyahu does not return to office, the question will resolve as No.

The primary source for resolution will be official announcements from the Israeli government. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be used.

title: Will new scientific research establish a link between playing golf and improved mental health by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, new scientific research establishes a statistically significant link between playing golf and improved mental health. 

The research must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and meet the following criteria:

- The study must include a sample size of at least 500 participants.
- The research must control for potential confounding variables such as age, gender, socioeconomic status, and pre-existing mental health conditions.
- The findings must be replicated in at least one additional peer-reviewed study.

The question resolves as YES if these criteria are met and the findings are reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Otherwise, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Sweden hold a national election before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Sweden holds a national election before January 1, 2029.

A national election is defined as an election for the Riksdag (the national legislature of Sweden). The date of the election must be officially recognized and reported by the Swedish Election Authority (Valmyndigheten) or confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

If an election is called but subsequently postponed beyond December 31, 2028, this question resolves as No.

title: Will Google release a quantum computer for commercial use by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google officially releases a quantum computer for commercial use. 

The release must be confirmed by an official announcement from Google and must be available for purchase or lease by businesses or individuals. The quantum computer must be intended for general commercial use, not limited to research or experimental purposes. 

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The quantum computer must be operational and not in a prototype or trial phase. Temporary releases or limited-time offers do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will any Major League Baseball (MLB) team owner run for a political office by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any current Major League Baseball (MLB) team owner officially declares their candidacy for any political office at the local, state, or national level in any country.

For the purposes of this question, an "MLB team owner" is defined as any individual who owns at least a 10% stake in an MLB team as of the date of their candidacy declaration.

The candidacy must be confirmed through an official announcement by the individual or their campaign, or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

The question resolves as No if no such declaration is made by the resolution date.

title: Will the number of NBA players with a degree in a natural science field increase by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the number of NBA players holding a degree in a natural science field (such as biology, chemistry, physics, or earth sciences) increases compared to the number as of January 1, 2023.

The degrees must be from accredited institutions and can be verified through official team rosters, player biographies, or reputable news sources (e.g., ESPN, The New York Times, The Guardian, BBC).

For the purpose of this question, 'natural science' does not include degrees in fields such as computer science, mathematics, or engineering.

In the event of conflicting information, the consensus among at least three major news organizations will determine the resolution.

title: Will North Korea develop and publicly announce an AI system capable of passing the Turing Test by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, North Korea develops and publicly announces an artificial intelligence (AI) system that is capable of passing the Turing Test.

The Turing Test is defined as a test of a machine's ability to exhibit intelligent behavior indistinguishable from that of a human, as proposed by Alan Turing. For the purposes of this question, the AI system must:

1. Engage in a text-based conversation with human judges without being identified as a machine more than 30% of the time over a series of 5-minute conversations.
2. The test must be administered by a reputable international organization or academic institution with expertise in AI and cognitive science.
3. The results must be publicly announced and verified by at least three major independent news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations are sufficient. If no such AI system is developed and announced by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Google release an AI that surpasses human performance in all major academic disciplines by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google releases an AI that surpasses average human performance across all major academic disciplines, including but not limited to:
- Natural Sciences (e.g., Physics, Chemistry, Biology)
- Mathematics
- Social Sciences (e.g., Economics, Psychology, Sociology)
- Humanities (e.g., History, Philosophy, Literature)
- Engineering and Technology

"Surpasses human performance" is defined as achieving higher scores than the average human in standardized tests, academic competitions, or peer-reviewed assessments in each of these disciplines.

The AI's performance must be verified by at least three reputable sources, such as major academic institutions, peer-reviewed journals, or recognized global competitions. In the absence of such verification, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The AI must be publicly available and not in a restricted or experimental phase. If Google releases multiple AIs, the question resolves as Yes if any one of them meets the criteria.

title: Will the European Union implement a comprehensive regulatory framework for artificial intelligence by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the European Union officially implements a comprehensive regulatory framework specifically for artificial intelligence (AI).

The framework must meet the following criteria:

- Be legally binding across all EU member states.
- Include regulations covering the development, deployment, and use of AI technologies.
- Address ethical considerations, data privacy, and security concerns related to AI.
- Be published in the Official Journal of the European Union.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official EU announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Partial regulations or guidelines that do not cover the full spectrum of AI-related issues, or are not legally binding, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Sweden hold a national referendum on joining NATO by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Sweden holds a national referendum in which the primary question is whether the country should join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO). The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the Swedish government and recognized as legitimate by international observers. Reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the occurrence of the referendum will suffice in the absence of official government documentation. The question resolves as No if no such referendum is held by the resolution date, or if the referendum is postponed or canceled without being rescheduled before the resolution date.

title: Will Ukraine join the European Union by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Ukraine is officially accepted as a member state of the European Union before January 1, 2028. 

Official acceptance is defined as the date when the European Union formally announces Ukraine's membership, following the completion of all required accession procedures and ratification by all existing EU member states. 

The announcement must be confirmed by an official EU press release or documentation. 

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If Ukraine's membership is still pending or not fully ratified by all EU member states by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Germany elect a Green Party candidate as Chancellor by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a candidate from the Green Party is officially elected as Chancellor of Germany. 

The election must be confirmed by the Federal Returning Officer (Bundeswahlleiter) or other official government documentation. 

In the event of a coalition government, the question will resolve as Yes if the elected Chancellor is a member of the Green Party at the time of their election. 

If the Chancellor steps down or is replaced before the end of their term, the question will still resolve as Yes as long as they were initially elected as Chancellor. 

In the event of an acting or interim Chancellor, the question will resolve as Yes only if the acting or interim Chancellor is officially recognized as holding the office by the Federal Returning Officer.

title: Will a candidate with a background in particle physics run for a major political office in any country by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a candidate with a background in particle physics runs for a major political office in any country.

For the purposes of this question:
- "Background in particle physics" is defined as having at least a Master's degree in particle physics or a closely related field, or having worked professionally in the field of particle physics for at least five years.
- "Major political office" includes positions such as President, Prime Minister, Member of Parliament, Senator, Governor, or Mayor of a major city.

The candidacy must be officially recognized by the relevant electoral authority. Verification will be based on official candidate lists, announcements by the candidate or their campaign, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Vladimir Putin remain the President of Russia through the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Vladimir Putin remains the President of Russia through December 31, 2028. 

"Remaining President" means that Vladimir Putin holds the official title of President of Russia, regardless of any changes to the powers or duties associated with the office. 

If Vladimir Putin resigns, is impeached, dies, or otherwise leaves office before December 31, 2028, this question resolves as No. 

The determination will be based on official announcements from the Russian government or credible reporting from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will OpenAI release a general-purpose AI that passes the Turing Test by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, OpenAI releases a general-purpose AI that passes the Turing Test.

The Turing Test is considered passed if the AI can engage in a text-based conversation with human judges such that the majority of judges (at least 70%) cannot distinguish the AI from a human after a continuous interaction of at least 30 minutes.

The AI must be publicly available and its performance in the Turing Test must be documented and verified by at least three reputable sources, such as peer-reviewed journals or major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of multiple AIs being released, the question resolves as Yes if any one of them meets the above criteria. Temporary demonstrations or limited-access trials do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will DeepMind's AlphaFold predict the structure of over 90% of human proteins by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, DeepMind's AlphaFold has predicted the structure of over 90% of human proteins.

The predictions must be publicly available in a reputable database such as the Protein Data Bank (PDB) or a similar authoritative source. The structures must be of sufficient quality to be considered useful by the scientific community, which can be validated through citations in peer-reviewed scientific literature or endorsements by recognized experts in the field of structural biology.

In the absence of direct confirmation from DeepMind, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Predictions made by any version of AlphaFold, including updates and successors, are applicable.

title: Will a commercially viable quantum computer be developed by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a commercially viable quantum computer is developed. A "commercially viable quantum computer" is defined as a quantum computing device that meets the following criteria: - It is available for purchase or lease by businesses or individuals outside of research institutions. - It can perform computations that are infeasible for classical computers within a reasonable timeframe. - It has a demonstrated error rate low enough to be practical for commercial applications, as evidenced by independent testing or peer-reviewed publications. - It has been publicly announced and marketed by a reputable company or organization. The verification of these criteria must come from credible sources, such as major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or peer-reviewed scientific journals. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations are sufficient.

title: Will Russia annex any new territories by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Russia officially annexes any new territories. The annexation must be confirmed by an official statement from the Russian government or documented in a credible report by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Territories are considered annexed if they are formally incorporated into the Russian Federation with legal and administrative changes reflecting this status. Temporary occupations or control without formal annexation do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new biotechnology breakthrough significantly extend human lifespan by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new biotechnology breakthrough is announced and meets the following criteria for significantly extending human lifespan:

1. The biotechnology must be a novel development, not an incremental improvement of existing technologies.
2. The breakthrough must be capable of extending the average human lifespan by at least 10 years.
3. The efficacy of the biotechnology must be demonstrated through peer-reviewed clinical trials or studies involving humans, with results published in reputable scientific journals.
4. The breakthrough must receive approval or recognition from at least one major health authority, such as the FDA, EMA, or WHO.

The question resolves as YES upon the official announcement and publication of the breakthrough meeting the above criteria. If no such breakthrough is announced and validated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the United Kingdom implement a nationwide ban on single-use plastics by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom enacts legislation that prohibits the use of single-use plastics nationwide. The legislation must be officially passed by the UK Parliament and come into effect by the resolution date. Single-use plastics include items such as plastic straws, cutlery, plates, and other disposable plastic products intended for one-time use. The ban must apply to the entire United Kingdom, including England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland. Exceptions for medical, scientific, or other specific uses do not count against this question's resolution. Confirmation must come from official government publications or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will an AI-driven military technology be deployed by Ukraine before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Ukraine officially deploys an AI-driven military technology for use in active military operations. The AI-driven military technology must meet the following criteria:

- Autonomy: The technology must incorporate artificial intelligence that enables autonomous decision-making or significantly enhances operational capabilities.
- Deployment: The technology must be actively used in military operations, not just in testing or development phases.

The deployment must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Ukrainian government or military. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary or limited deployments for specific events or exercises do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will NATO adopt a unified AI strategy for defense by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, NATO officially adopts a unified AI strategy for defense. 

"Unified AI strategy for defense" is defined as a comprehensive, coordinated plan or framework that outlines the use, development, and deployment of artificial intelligence technologies across NATO member states for defense purposes. 

The adoption must be confirmed through an official NATO announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The strategy must be operational and not merely a proposal or in the planning stages. It should include specific guidelines or policies for AI integration in defense systems, interoperability standards among member states, and a timeline for implementation. 

In case of partial adoption (e.g., limited to specific member states or areas of defense), the question will resolve as Yes if the strategy is intended for full NATO-wide implementation. Temporary or trial strategies do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Kingdom pass comprehensive AI regulations by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the United Kingdom enacts comprehensive AI regulations. 

"Comprehensive AI regulations" are defined as laws or legally binding regulations that address multiple aspects of AI development, deployment, and use, including but not limited to:
- Ethical guidelines for AI development and use
- Data privacy and protection standards
- Accountability and transparency requirements for AI systems
- Safety and security measures for AI applications
- Impact assessments for AI technologies

The regulations must be officially passed by the UK Parliament and come into effect. 

Confirmation of the enactment must come from an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If the regulations are repealed or significantly amended before the resolution date, this question resolves as No.

title: Will a new political party win a majority in the French parliamentary elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a political party that did not exist before January 1, 2024, wins a majority of the seats in the French National Assembly during a parliamentary election.

"Majority" is defined as more than 50% of the total seats in the National Assembly.

The new political party must be officially registered and recognized by the French Ministry of the Interior.

The results must be confirmed by official election results as published by the French government or reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., Le Monde, AFP, Reuters, BBC).

In the event of a coalition, the question resolves as Yes only if the new political party itself wins more than 50% of the seats, not counting seats won by coalition partners.

title: Will a new political party win a majority in the Swedish parliamentary elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a political party that did not have any seats in the Swedish parliament (Riksdag) before the 2026 general election wins more than 50% of the 349 seats in the Riksdag during any parliamentary election held before the resolution date.

The official results must be confirmed by the Swedish Election Authority (Valmyndigheten). In the event of a dispute, the final decision by the Swedish Election Review Board (Valprövningsnämnden) will be considered authoritative.

A "new political party" is defined as a party that had no representation in the Riksdag prior to the 2026 general election.

In case of a coalition or alliance, the question resolves as No unless a single new political party meets the above criteria independently.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) include AI ethics as a major part of their platform in the 2028 election?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Democratic Party of the United States officially includes AI ethics as a significant part of their platform for the 2028 election. 

"AI ethics" refers to policies, guidelines, or principles aimed at ensuring the ethical development, deployment, and use of artificial intelligence technologies. 

"Major part of their platform" means that AI ethics is prominently featured in official party documents, speeches, or announcements related to the 2028 election and is identified as a key issue or priority. 

Official confirmation can be derived from any of the following sources: 
- The Democratic Party's official platform document for the 2028 election. 
- Public statements or speeches by the Democratic Party's presidential candidate or party chairperson. 
- Credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

If there is ambiguity or dispute over whether AI ethics is a major part of the platform, the question will resolve based on a consensus of expert political analysts from at least three major news organizations.

title: Will the Republican Party retain control of the US House of Representatives after the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, after the 2028 United States House of Representatives elections, the Republican Party holds more seats than any other party.

The determination will be based on the official results published by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or an equivalent authoritative source. If there is any dispute or recount, the resolution will be based on the final certified results. In case of a tie, the question will resolve as No.

Independent or third-party members who caucus with the Republican Party will not be counted as Republican seats.

title: Will France elect a female president by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a female candidate is officially declared the winner of a French presidential election by December 31, 2028. 
The winner must be confirmed by the French Constitutional Council (Conseil constitutionnel) as having received the majority of votes in the final round of the election. 
In the event of a dispute or recount, the resolution will be based on the final decision of the French Constitutional Council. 
If no election is held by the end of 2028, or if a female candidate is not declared the winner by the French Constitutional Council, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will Switzerland implement national regulations for robotics by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland has officially implemented national regulations specifically governing the use, development, or deployment of robotics. The regulations must be enacted by the Swiss Federal Assembly or another relevant national authority. The implementation of these regulations must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The regulations must be in force, not just proposed or in draft form. Regional or local regulations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland hold a national referendum on joining an international alliance by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland holds a national referendum on joining any international alliance. An 'international alliance' is defined as an organization or agreement between multiple countries for mutual benefit, which includes but is not limited to military, economic, or political alliances. 

The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the Swiss Federal Council and announced in an official government publication. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The question resolves as No if no such referendum is held by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled before it takes place.

title: Will the European Union expand to include new member states by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any new member state(s) officially join the European Union. 

A new member state is considered to have joined the European Union if the accession treaty has been signed and ratified by all current EU member states and the candidate country, and the country has officially become a member state as recognized by the European Commission. 

In the event of partial or conditional membership, this question resolves as Yes only if full membership is granted. 

The accession must be confirmed by an official announcement from the European Commission or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will there be any major geopolitical events impacting particle physics research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any major geopolitical event significantly impacts particle physics research. 'Major geopolitical event' is defined as:
- A conflict, war, or military action involving at least one major world power (e.g., USA, China, Russia, EU).
- Significant international sanctions or embargoes affecting scientific collaboration or funding.
- Major political upheaval or regime change in a country hosting significant particle physics research facilities (e.g., CERN in Switzerland).

The impact on particle physics research must be verifiable through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post), or official announcements from relevant scientific institutions or government bodies.

Examples of impacts include:
- Suspension or termination of major particle physics experiments or projects.
- Significant delays in research timelines due to geopolitical tensions.
- Loss of funding or resources critical to ongoing particle physics research.

If no such events are reported by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will India become a permanent member of the UN Security Council by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, India becomes a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council.

A permanent member is defined as a country that has been granted permanent membership status with all associated rights and responsibilities, including veto power.

The resolution will be based on official announcements from the United Nations or confirmation from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of such confirmation, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Israel sign a formal peace agreement with Saudi Arabia by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Israel and Saudi Arabia sign a formal peace agreement. The agreement must be officially announced and signed by representatives of both countries' governments.

The agreement must include provisions for the normalization of diplomatic relations, which may include but are not limited to the establishment of embassies, exchange of ambassadors, or mutual recognition of sovereignty.

The signing of the agreement must be reported by at least three major reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the majority consensus of these sources.

title: Will Japan conduct a national election that is recognized as free and fair by international observers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Japan conducts a national election that is recognized as free and fair by international observers. The election must be for a national office, such as the House of Representatives or the House of Councillors.

The recognition of the election as free and fair must come from at least two reputable international organizations, such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE). Reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the election's free and fair status are also acceptable.

If there are conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the majority consensus of the aforementioned organizations and news sources. In the event of no national election being held by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an electronic voting system be widely adopted in at least 3 countries by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, at least three countries have officially adopted an electronic voting system for national elections.

An "electronic voting system" is defined as a system where votes are cast, recorded, transmitted, and counted using electronic means. This includes, but is not limited to, Direct Recording Electronic (DRE) voting machines, optical scan voting systems, and online voting platforms.

"Widely adopted" means that the system is used in at least 50% of the voting precincts or districts within the country for national elections.

The adoption must be confirmed by official government announcements or documentation from the respective countries. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary or pilot implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major national election be postponed due to a significant event related to soccer by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a major national election in any country is officially postponed due to a significant event related to soccer (football).

A "major national election" is defined as any election for the head of state, head of government, or national legislative body.

A "significant event related to soccer" can include, but is not limited to:
- A major international tournament (e.g., FIFA World Cup, UEFA European Championship) causing logistical or security concerns.
- A national tragedy or disaster occurring during a soccer event, leading to widespread disruption.
- Political or civil unrest directly linked to a soccer event.

The postponement must be confirmed by an official government announcement or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

If multiple elections are postponed, the first confirmed instance will be used for resolution. If no such postponement occurs by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will China develop a quantum computer that achieves quantum supremacy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a quantum computer developed in China achieves quantum supremacy. Quantum supremacy is defined as the demonstration of a quantum computer performing a calculation that is infeasible for any classical computer to perform within a reasonable time frame.

The achievement must be recognized and verified by at least one of the following authoritative sources:
- A peer-reviewed scientific journal publication confirming the quantum supremacy claim.
- An official announcement from a recognized Chinese research institution or government body.
- Reports from at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of a dispute or conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on a consensus among the majority of the aforementioned sources. If no consensus is reached, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Microsoft release a commercially successful quantum computer by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Microsoft releases a quantum computer that meets the following criteria for commercial success:

- The quantum computer must be available for purchase or lease by businesses or consumers.
- The quantum computer must achieve at least $100 million in revenue within the first year of its release.
- The quantum computer must be capable of performing computations that are demonstrably advantageous over classical computers for specific tasks.

Confirmation of these criteria must come from credible sources such as financial reports from Microsoft, industry analysis from reputable firms (e.g., Gartner, IDC), or coverage by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a new geopolitical alliance form in Asia by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new geopolitical alliance is officially formed in Asia. The alliance must meet the following criteria: 
- It must include at least three sovereign countries as members. 
- It must be formalized through a treaty, agreement, or official declaration. 
- The alliance must have a defined purpose, such as economic cooperation, military collaboration, or political partnership. 
- The formation of the alliance must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

In the event of ambiguity, the question will resolve based on the consensus of expert analysis from reputable geopolitical think tanks or academic institutions.

title: Will the geopolitical influence of the US in international sports, such as basketball, increase by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is clear and measurable evidence that the geopolitical influence of the United States in international sports, specifically basketball, has increased. This can be demonstrated through any of the following:

- An increase in the number of US-based players participating in international basketball leagues (such as the EuroLeague) by at least 20% compared to 2023 levels.
- An increase in the number of international basketball teams employing US-based coaches by at least 20% compared to 2023 levels.
- An increase in the number of international basketball tournaments or events hosted in the United States by at least 20% compared to 2023 levels.
- A significant increase in the media coverage and broadcasting rights of US basketball leagues (such as the NBA) in international markets, as reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of official statistics, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be used to verify these criteria.

If none of these criteria are met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will quantum computing play a significant role in international espionage by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is credible evidence that quantum computing has been used in international espionage activities. The criteria for credible evidence are:

1. Public Disclosure: Official statements or documents from government agencies (e.g., NSA, GCHQ, FSB) confirming the use of quantum computing in espionage.
2. Major News Reports: Investigative reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) corroborating the use of quantum computing in espionage.
3. Academic or Industry Reports: Publications in peer-reviewed journals or reports from credible cybersecurity firms detailing the use of quantum computing in espionage activities.

The espionage activities must involve the use of quantum computing for tasks such as code-breaking, secure communications interception, or other intelligence-gathering operations. Mere speculation or theoretical discussions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War result in a change of national borders by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there is an official and internationally recognized change in the national borders of either Russia or Ukraine as a direct result of the Russo-Ukrainian War.

The change must be confirmed by at least two of the following sources: United Nations, European Union, NATO, or at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

The change must be permanent and not a temporary occupation or control. Any changes resulting from a mutual agreement, treaty, or armistice will count towards this question's resolution. In the absence of a clear official change, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major political scandal involving a professional golfer emerge in the United Kingdom before 2028?
Will the United Kingdom implement national regulations on the use of robotics in public spaces by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom enacts and implements nationwide regulations specifically addressing the use of robotics in public spaces. 

The regulations must meet the following criteria:

- Be officially enacted by the UK Parliament or relevant regulatory authority and come into effect by the resolution date.
- Specifically address the deployment, operation, and oversight of robotic systems in public spaces, including but not limited to streets, parks, and public transportation.
- Be reported by at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

If only guidelines, recommendations, or non-binding policies are issued, or if the regulations are limited to specific regions or cities without a nationwide scope, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a third-party candidate win a US Senate seat by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a candidate who is not affiliated with either the Democratic Party or the Republican Party wins a United States Senate seat in any state. The candidate must be officially recognized as a third-party candidate by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or a reputable news organization (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The win must be confirmed by official election results published by the relevant state authority. In the event of a contested election, the final outcome as determined by the appropriate legal and electoral processes will be considered.

title: Will Switzerland implement a national policy on AI ethics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland officially implements a national policy specifically addressing AI ethics. 

The policy must be a formal, government-issued document that outlines ethical guidelines, principles, or regulations for the development, deployment, and use of artificial intelligence technologies within Switzerland. 

The implementation must be confirmed either through an official government announcement or publication in an official government gazette. 

In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice. The policy must be in effect, not merely proposed or under discussion.

title: Will Iran announce a significant breakthrough in AI technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Iran announces a significant breakthrough in artificial intelligence (AI) technology. A 'significant breakthrough' is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- The development of an AI system that achieves performance on par with or superior to state-of-the-art models in a well-established benchmark (e.g., ImageNet for image recognition, GLUE for natural language processing).
- The creation of a novel AI algorithm or architecture that is widely recognized by the global AI research community and cited in peer-reviewed journals or presented at major AI conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR).
- A major advancement in AI applications that leads to substantial improvements in a specific domain (e.g., healthcare, autonomous vehicles, natural disaster prediction) and is covered by reputable international news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The announcement must be made by an official Iranian government entity or a recognized Iranian research institution. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major international news organizations are sufficient to resolve this question as Yes.

title: Will the United Nations adopt a unified AI strategy for member states by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations officially adopts a unified AI strategy that member states are encouraged or required to follow.

The strategy must be formally documented and publicly accessible, outlining guidelines, principles, or regulations concerning the development, deployment, and governance of artificial intelligence technologies.

The adoption of the strategy must be confirmed through an official UN resolution, announcement, or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The strategy must be comprehensive, addressing multiple aspects of AI such as ethics, safety, privacy, and international cooperation. A partial or draft strategy does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Russia's GDP surpass 2 trillion USD by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Russia's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) surpasses 2 trillion USD. The GDP figure must be based on official data released by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank. In the absence of data from these sources, data from Russia's Federal State Statistics Service (Rosstat) will be considered. The GDP must be measured in current US dollars, not adjusted for inflation. If multiple sources report different figures, the highest reported figure will be used for resolution. If no official data is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United States implement a nationwide AI regulation framework by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States has officially implemented a nationwide regulatory framework specifically governing the development, deployment, and use of artificial intelligence technologies.

The regulatory framework must include, at a minimum, guidelines or rules addressing the following aspects:
- Ethical considerations and responsible AI use
- Data privacy and security
- Transparency and explainability of AI systems
- Accountability and liability for AI-driven decisions

The implementation must be confirmed through an official government announcement or publication in the Federal Register. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) are sufficient.

The framework must be nationwide, covering all states, and not limited to specific sectors or temporary measures. If the framework is implemented in stages, it must be clear that the intention is for comprehensive nationwide coverage.

title: Will Donald Trump publicly endorse an AI research initiative by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Donald Trump publicly endorses an AI research initiative. A public endorsement is defined as a clear and explicit statement of support made by Donald Trump, either through his official social media accounts, public speeches, interviews, or press releases.

The endorsement must specifically mention support for an AI research initiative, which can include projects, organizations, or policies aimed at advancing artificial intelligence research. General statements supporting AI without reference to a specific initiative do not count.

The endorsement must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) to be considered valid.

In the event of ambiguity or dispute, the resolution will be based on the consensus of reputable news sources and expert analysis.

title: Will AI-driven technology be used to assist referees in major soccer tournaments by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven technology is officially used to assist referees in at least one major soccer tournament. Major soccer tournaments are defined as the FIFA World Cup, UEFA European Championship, Copa America, or any equivalent tournament organized by a recognized continental football federation. The AI-driven technology must be used in real-time decision-making during matches and should be acknowledged by the tournament's official governing body. Use of AI-driven technology in trials, friendly matches, or unofficial tournaments does not count. Confirmation must come from an official announcement by the governing body of the tournament or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the United States lead in the number of Nobel Prizes in Natural Sciences by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States has been awarded more Nobel Prizes in the Natural Sciences (Physics, Chemistry, and Physiology or Medicine) than any other country for the years 2024 through 2028. The Nobel Prizes considered will be those announced by the Nobel Assembly and listed on the official Nobel Prize website (nobelprize.org). In the event of a tie in the number of Nobel Prizes awarded, the question will resolve as No. Prizes awarded to organizations or international collaborations will not be counted towards any country's total.

title: Will Switzerland hold a national referendum on joining the European Union before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Switzerland holds a national referendum specifically on the issue of joining the European Union.

The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the Swiss Federal Council or the Swiss Federal Assembly. The question must explicitly ask whether Switzerland should join the European Union. Referendums on related but distinct issues, such as closer ties with the EU or joining specific EU programs, do not count.

Confirmation of the referendum must come from an official announcement by the Swiss government or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of ambiguity, the question will be resolved based on the consensus of reputable sources.

title: Will Amazon face antitrust actions from the European Union before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the European Union initiates formal antitrust proceedings against Amazon. 

'Antitrust actions' are defined as formal legal actions taken by the European Union's regulatory bodies aimed at investigating or prosecuting Amazon for alleged violations of competition laws. 

The initiation of such actions must be confirmed by an official announcement from the European Commission or other relevant EU regulatory bodies. Alternatively, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question resolves as No if no such formal antitrust proceedings are initiated by the specified date.

title: Will the NBA expand to include a team from outside North America by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the NBA formally announces the inclusion of a new team from a country outside of North America (defined as Canada, the United States, and Mexico).

The announcement must come from an official NBA source, such as a press release on the NBA's official website or a statement from a high-ranking NBA official (e.g., the NBA Commissioner).

The team must be officially scheduled to participate in the NBA regular season games. Mere discussions, proposals, or intentions to expand do not count towards this question's resolution.

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) confirming the expansion will suffice.

title: Will the MLB host a regular season game in a new country by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Major League Baseball (MLB) hosts a regular season game in a country where no regular season MLB game has been played before, by December 31, 2028. The game must be an official regular season game, not a pre-season or exhibition game. Confirmation must come from an official MLB announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

title: Will a new black hole be discovered by scientists by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a new black hole is discovered by scientists and meets the following criteria:

- The discovery is confirmed through observational data or indirect evidence by a recognized scientific authority such as NASA, ESA, or a major astronomical observatory.
- The discovery is published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or announced at a major scientific conference.
- The black hole must be a new discovery, not a reclassification or reinterpretation of previously known data.

In case of multiple discoveries, the resolution will be based on the date of the official announcement of the first discovery.

title: Will Israel develop a quantum computer with more than 100 qubits by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Israel develops a quantum computer with a qubit count exceeding 100.

The quantum computer must meet the following criteria:
- The qubits must be functional and capable of maintaining coherence for a time period sufficient to perform a computation.
- The quantum computer must be capable of running a quantum algorithm demonstrating entanglement and superposition with more than 100 qubits.

Verification of the quantum computer’s capabilities must come from an official announcement by an Israeli government agency or a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

This question resolves as NO if these criteria are not met by the resolution date.

title: Will quantum computing be used to develop new treatments or drugs by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, quantum computing technology is used to develop new treatments or drugs that meet the following criteria:

- The treatment or drug must be a novel development, not a minor modification of an existing one.
- The development must be directly attributed to the use of quantum computing in the research and development process.
- The treatment or drug must receive approval from a major regulatory body such as the FDA (U.S. Food and Drug Administration), EMA (European Medicines Agency), or an equivalent authority in another country.

The use of quantum computing must be confirmed through credible sources, including scientific publications, official announcements from pharmaceutical companies, or reports from reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, etc.).

In case of ambiguity, the resolution will be based on the consensus of experts in the fields of quantum computing and pharmaceuticals.

title: Will Germany increase its military spending to 2% of its GDP by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Germany's military spending reaches or exceeds 2% of its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for that year. The determination will be based on official data released by the German Federal Statistical Office (Destatis) or confirmed by reputable international organizations such as NATO or the World Bank. If there are discrepancies between sources, the data from Destatis will take precedence. This question resolves as NO if the spending does not reach 2% by the specified date.

title: Will a member state leave the European Union before the end of 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, an official and legally binding declaration of intent to leave the European Union is made by a member state government. The declaration must be formally submitted to the European Council in accordance with Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union. The question will resolve as No if no such declaration is made by the resolution date. In case of ambiguity, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be used to resolve the question.

title: Will a new fundamental particle be discovered in Physics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a new fundamental particle is discovered and meets the following criteria:

- The particle must be confirmed through experimental evidence and peer-reviewed publication.
- The discovery must be recognized by the scientific community, specifically by organizations such as CERN or a major physics journal (e.g., Physical Review Letters, Journal of High Energy Physics).
- The particle must be distinct from previously known particles in the Standard Model or any established extensions of the Standard Model.

In the event of a disputed discovery, the resolution will be based on a consensus within the scientific community or a formal recognition by a major scientific body.

title: Will Canada implement a nationwide policy to protect at least 30% of its natural habitats by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Canada implements a nationwide policy that legally protects at least 30% of its natural habitats. 

The policy must be officially enacted through federal legislation or regulation.
