The protected natural habitats must include a mix of terrestrial, freshwater, and marine areas. 

Confirmation of the policy's implementation must come from an official government announcement or documentation, or be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., CBC, The Globe and Mail, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times). 

Temporary protections, pilot programs, or regional policies that do not cover the entire nation will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland introduce new political reforms to address climate change by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland enacts new political reforms specifically aimed at addressing climate change. 

"Political reforms" are defined as new laws, regulations, or policies officially adopted by the Swiss Federal Assembly or through a national referendum. 

The reforms must explicitly mention climate change mitigation or adaptation in their text and demonstrate a clear intent to address climate-related issues.

Confirmation of the enactment must come from an official government announcement or publication in the Swiss Federal Gazette. 
In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If multiple reforms are introduced, at least one must meet the above criteria for the question to resolve as Yes.

Temporary measures or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will China hold a national election before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, China holds a national election in which citizens can vote for the country's head of state or head of government. 

The election must meet the following criteria:
- Be officially sanctioned by the Chinese government as a national election.
- Allow for the participation of multiple candidates or parties.
- Be reported by at least three major international news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

If the election is annulled or deemed illegitimate by international observers such as the United Nations or the European Union, this question will resolve as No.

In the event of partial or regional elections, the question will resolve as No unless these elections are part of a phased national election process officially recognized by the Chinese government.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a significant election reform legislation by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the US House of Representatives passes a significant election reform legislation.

"Significant election reform legislation" is defined as a bill that introduces substantial changes to federal election laws or procedures. This can include, but is not limited to:
- Changes to voter registration processes
- Changes to voting methods or technologies
- Changes to redistricting procedures
- Measures to enhance election security and integrity
- Measures to expand or restrict voting rights

The passage of the legislation must be confirmed by official records from the US House of Representatives or reputable news sources such as the New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, or Reuters.

In the event of multiple bills being passed, the resolution will consider the first bill that meets the criteria.

If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will robotics technology be used to conduct voting processes in any country by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, robotics technology is used to conduct voting processes in any country. 

Robotics technology refers to automated systems, machines, or robots capable of performing tasks typically carried out by humans. The use of such technology must be officially sanctioned by the country’s electoral authority and publicly announced. 

The robotic system must be involved in at least one of the following aspects of the voting process:
- Voter registration
- Ballot distribution or collection
- Vote tallying
- Voter identification and authentication

The deployment of robotics technology must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a baseball player run for a major political office in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a person who has played at least one Major League Baseball (MLB) game runs for a major political office in the United States. 'Major political office' is defined as:
- President or Vice President of the United States
- U.S. Senator
- U.S. Representative
- Governor of a U.S. state

The candidacy must be officially declared and recognized by the relevant election authority. Independent runs, as well as those affiliated with a political party, are eligible. The question resolves as No if no such candidacy is declared by the resolution date.

title: Will the Liberal Party win the most seats in the Canadian federal election in 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Liberal Party wins the most seats in the Canadian federal election held in 2028. The number of seats won by each party will be determined based on the official results announced by Elections Canada. In the event of a tie, where the Liberal Party and another party win an equal number of seats, the question will resolve as No. If the election is delayed or postponed beyond 2028, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Ukraine hold a presidential election deemed free and fair by international observers before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Ukraine holds a presidential election that is deemed free and fair by major international observers.

"Free and fair" means that the election process, including campaigning, voting, and counting, adheres to democratic standards without significant irregularities or coercion. 

The assessment must come from at least two of the following organizations: the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE), the European Union (EU), the United Nations (UN), or reputable non-governmental organizations such as Human Rights Watch or the Carter Center.

In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the majority of these organizations.

title: Will a Major League Baseball (MLB) team use AI to assist in game strategy decisions by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any Major League Baseball (MLB) team officially uses artificial intelligence (AI) to assist in game strategy decisions during regular season or postseason games.

The AI must be used in real-time to make or recommend strategic decisions such as player substitutions, pitching changes, or defensive alignments. The use of AI must be confirmed by an official statement from the MLB team or the league itself. In the absence of an official statement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient.

The AI must be more than a statistical analysis tool; it must actively contribute to decision-making during games. Use of AI solely for scouting, training, or injury prevention does not count towards this question's resolution.

In the event of partial or trial use, the question will resolve as Yes if the AI is intended for ongoing use in game strategy decisions.

title: Will the US dollar be fully integrated into a blockchain-based financial system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the US dollar is fully integrated into a blockchain-based financial system that meets the following criteria:

- The blockchain-based financial system must be officially recognized and regulated by the US government.
- The system must support the issuance, transfer, and storage of US dollars directly on a blockchain, without the need for intermediaries.
- The system must be used for at least 10% of all US dollar transactions, as measured by transaction volume or value, over a continuous 30-day period.
- The integration must be confirmed by an official announcement from the US Department of the Treasury or the Federal Reserve, or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The system must be operational and not in a trial or pilot phase.

In the absence of such confirmation, this question resolves as No.

title: Will Russia develop a quantum computer that surpasses 100 qubits by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Russia develops a quantum computer that surpasses 100 qubits. The following criteria must be met:
- The quantum computer must be officially announced by the Russian government or a reputable Russian scientific institution.
- The quantum computer must be operational and its qubit count independently verified by at least two reputable sources, such as peer-reviewed scientific journals or major international conferences.
- The quantum computer must demonstrate practical computation or problem-solving capabilities beyond experimental setups.

If these conditions are not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Canada establish a new national park by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Government of Canada officially establishes a new national park. 

"Establishes" is defined as the formal designation and creation of a national park through legislation or an official government decree. 

The establishment must be publicly announced by the Parks Canada Agency or a relevant governmental body. 

In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (CBC, The Globe and Mail, National Post, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The national park must be intended for long-term preservation and public use, not a temporary designation or a reclassification of an existing park.

title: Will Switzerland hold a national referendum on electoral reform by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland holds a national referendum specifically focused on electoral reform. 

"Electoral reform" is defined as any proposed change to the electoral system used to elect representatives at the national level. This includes, but is not limited to, changes in voting methods, districting, or the structure of the electoral process.

The referendum must be officially sanctioned and recognized by the Swiss Federal Council. 

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the event.

If the referendum is postponed or canceled, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Democratic Party secure a majority in the US Congress in the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, following the 2028 United States congressional elections, the Democratic Party holds a majority of seats in both the House of Representatives and the Senate. 

A majority is defined as holding more than 50% of the seats in each chamber. 

The resolution will be based on the official election results as certified by the Federal Election Commission (FEC). 

In the event of contested results or recounts, the resolution will be based on the final certified results. If no majority is secured in either chamber, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will Russia develop an AI system that surpasses GPT-4 in natural language processing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, an AI system developed primarily by Russian entities surpasses GPT-4 in natural language processing capabilities. The AI system must meet or exceed GPT-4 in the following criteria:
- Performance on standardized benchmarks such as GLUE, SuperGLUE, or equivalent.
- Demonstrated proficiency in tasks including but not limited to text generation, translation, summarization, and question-answering.
- Peer-reviewed publications or evaluations by recognized AI researchers confirming its superiority over GPT-4.

The AI system's development must be attributed primarily to Russian organizations or researchers, and the claim must be substantiated by credible sources such as major AI conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML) or reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of multiple AI systems claiming superiority, the one with the earliest verified achievement date will be considered. If no such system is recognized by the resolution date, this question resolves as No.

title: Will Canada become a leading country in quantum computing research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Canada is recognized as a leading country in quantum computing research based on the following criteria:
- Publication: Canada-based researchers or institutions must have published at least 10% of the top 100 most-cited papers in quantum computing in the preceding three years.
- Funding: Canada must be among the top three countries in terms of government or private funding allocated to quantum computing research in the preceding three years.
- Innovation: Canadian institutions or companies must have developed or significantly contributed to at least three major advancements or breakthroughs in quantum computing technology, as recognized by leading scientific organizations or publications.
Recognition of Canada's leading status must be confirmed by credible sources such as Nature, Science, or reports from major research institutions or think tanks.
In the absence of clear recognition, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Nations implement a global initiative to combat climate change by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations officially implements a global initiative specifically aimed at combating climate change. 

The initiative must meet the following criteria:
- Be formally adopted by the UN General Assembly or the UN Security Council.
- Include specific, actionable measures aimed at reducing global greenhouse gas emissions or mitigating the effects of climate change.
- Be endorsed by at least two-thirds of the UN member states.

The implementation must be confirmed through an official UN announcement or resolution. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Initiatives that are regional or not globally coordinated, or those that do not specifically target climate change, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will California implement blockchain-based voting systems in statewide elections by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, California officially implements a blockchain-based voting system for any statewide election. The system must be used to record and verify votes in an actual election and not merely be in a pilot or testing phase. The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the California Secretary of State or another relevant government authority. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational and used in an official statewide election. Temporary or partial implementations (e.g., limited to specific counties or districts) do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a candidate from a new political party win the general election in Spain by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a candidate from a political party that did not exist before January 1, 2024, wins the general election in Spain. 

A "new political party" is defined as a political party that was officially registered after January 1, 2024. 

Winning the general election is defined as having the candidate elected as the President of the Government of Spain (Prime Minister) following the election, confirmed through official election results announced by the Spanish Ministry of the Interior or another authoritative government body. 

In the event of a coalition government, the question will resolve as Yes if the candidate from the new political party is appointed as the President of the Government. 

If the election results are disputed or challenged, the resolution will be based on the final, certified results. In the absence of official certification, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered.

title: Will AI developed by DeepMind be used to predict election outcomes in any major country by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI developed by DeepMind is used to predict the outcome of a national election in any major country. A 'major country' is defined as one of the G20 nations. The prediction must be publicly announced before the election results are officially declared. Confirmation can come from an official statement by DeepMind or from credible reports by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The AI must be explicitly credited with making the prediction, and the prediction must pertain to the overall winner of the election or the distribution of seats in a parliamentary system. Predictions made for local or regional elections do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland host an international conference on quantum computing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Switzerland hosts an international conference focused on quantum computing.

An "international conference" is defined as a conference that:
- Has participants from at least 10 different countries.
- Features presentations or panels from recognized experts in the field of quantum computing.

The conference must be publicly announced and documented on an official website or through credible sources such as major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

The conference must be held physically in Switzerland, not virtually. The question resolves as NO if the conference is canceled or postponed beyond the resolution date.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass an impeachment resolution before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the US House of Representatives passes an impeachment resolution against a sitting President, Vice President, or any other federal official as outlined in Article II, Section 4 of the United States Constitution. 

The passage of the impeachment resolution must be confirmed by an official record from the Clerk of the US House of Representatives or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters). 

In the event of multiple impeachment resolutions, the question will resolve as Yes upon the passage of any one resolution. If no impeachment resolution is passed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Ukraine conduct a national election before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Ukraine conducts a national election before January 1, 2029. A national election refers to any election in which citizens vote to elect representatives to a national legislative body, such as the Verkhovna Rada (Ukrainian Parliament), or for the President of Ukraine.

The election must be officially sanctioned by the Ukrainian government and reported by at least three reputable news organizations, such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or Reuters. The election must be open to the general electorate and not limited to a specific subset of the population.

In the event of a disputed election, this question will resolve based on the outcome recognized by the majority of international observers and reputable news organizations. If no national election is held by the specified date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United States see a voter turnout of over 70% in the 2028 presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the voter turnout in the 2028 United States presidential election exceeds 70% as reported by the United States Election Assistance Commission (EAC) or another official government body overseeing federal elections. The voter turnout percentage should be calculated based on the total number of votes cast divided by the total number of eligible voters. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the EAC's report will take precedence. If the EAC does not provide a report, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be used. The question will resolve as No if the turnout does not exceed 70% or if there is insufficient information to confirm the turnout percentage.

title: Will the United States host the FIFA World Cup before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the United States hosts any FIFA World Cup match, whether as the primary host, co-host, or substitute host for another country. 

The hosting must be confirmed by an official announcement from FIFA or the United States Soccer Federation (USSF). In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The term 'host' includes hosting any official FIFA World Cup match, including group stage, knockout stage, or the final. Hosting only related events, such as draws or ceremonies, does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the European Union implement new regulations for the protection of endangered species by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements new regulations specifically aimed at the protection of endangered species.

To qualify as 'new regulations,' the measures must meet the following criteria:
1. They must be legally binding across all EU member states.
2. They must introduce new protective measures or significantly amend existing regulations to enhance the protection of endangered species.
3. They must be officially adopted and published in the Official Journal of the European Union.

The implementation of these regulations must be confirmed by an official announcement from the European Commission or the European Parliament, or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event that only some member states implement the regulations, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Iran and the United States restore the nuclear deal by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Iran and the United States officially restore the nuclear deal, formally known as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), or any equivalent agreement aimed at limiting Iran's nuclear capabilities in exchange for sanction relief. The restoration must be confirmed through official announcements from both the Iranian government and the United States government. In the absence of direct official announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The agreement must be officially signed and ratified by both parties. Interim agreements, partial agreements, or agreements involving only some aspects of the JCPOA do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Amazon face antitrust legislation passed by the US Congress by 2028?
body: This question addresses the potential for new antitrust laws targeting major corporations like Amazon, and whether such legislation will be enacted by the US Congress by 2028.

title: Will Taiwan's 2028 presidential election result in a pro-independence candidate winning?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate who is publicly in favor of Taiwan's independence wins the 2028 presidential election in Taiwan.

A candidate is considered pro-independence if they have, at any point during their campaign, expressed support for Taiwan's independence from China either in speeches, official campaign materials, or policy proposals. 

The election result must be officially confirmed by Taiwan's Central Election Commission. In the event of a dispute or recount, the final decision recognized by the Central Election Commission will be used for resolution. 

If no candidate explicitly supports independence, or if the election is annulled or indefinitely postponed, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Sweden implement a national AI strategy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Sweden officially implements a national AI strategy. The strategy must be a formal, government-approved document outlining Sweden's approach to the development, regulation, and promotion of artificial intelligence technologies. This implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or publication on a government website. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (such as BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The strategy must be nationwide and not limited to specific regions or sectors. Temporary or trial strategies do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Kingdom establish a new research center focused on computational mathematics by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom has officially established a new research center dedicated to computational mathematics. The establishment of the center must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation from a recognized academic institution. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The center must be operational and conducting research in computational mathematics. Temporary research initiatives or expansions of existing centers do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Amazon develop a quantum computer that achieves quantum supremacy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Amazon develops a quantum computer that achieves quantum supremacy. Quantum supremacy is defined as the ability of a quantum computer to solve a problem that no classical computer can solve within a reasonable timeframe.

The achievement must be validated by one of the following:
- A peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific journal.
- Confirmation by at least two major independent research institutions or organizations specializing in quantum computing.

The validation must include a detailed description of the problem solved, the methodology used, and evidence that classical computers cannot solve the problem in a reasonable timeframe. Reports from reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered for additional context but are not sufficient for resolution on their own.

In the event of a dispute or ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific community will be used to determine the outcome.

title: Will the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party win more than 15% of the vote in the 2028 German federal elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party secures more than 15% of the total vote in the 2028 German federal elections.

The percentage of the vote will be determined based on the official election results published by the Federal Returning Officer (Bundeswahlleiter). If the official results are not available by the resolution date, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered.

In the event of a dispute over the election results, the question will resolve based on the outcome of any official recounts or legal challenges that conclude by the resolution date.

If the elections are postponed or canceled, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a candidate from California win the 2028 United States presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate who is a current resident of California wins the 2028 United States presidential election. A "current resident" is defined as an individual who has maintained primary residency in California for at least six months prior to the general election date. The candidate must be officially listed on the California voter registration rolls as of the general election date. The winner of the election is determined by the candidate who receives a majority of the Electoral College votes as certified by the United States Congress. In the event of a dispute or recount, the resolution will be based on the final certified result. If the election is not resolved by January 20, 2029, the question will be resolved based on the individual who is inaugurated as President on that date. Authoritative sources for determining the winner include official announcements by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) and reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a candidate with a background in Physics be elected to a national office in any European Union country by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a candidate with a background in Physics is elected to a national office in any European Union country.

A "background in Physics" is defined as having at least a Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Physics or a closely related field, such as Applied Physics or Theoretical Physics, from a recognized institution.

"National office" refers to any elected position at the national level, such as a member of parliament, senator, president, or prime minister.

The election must be officially recognized by the relevant national electoral authority. Confirmation can come from an official government announcement or documentation, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of a disputed election, the question will resolve based on the final official outcome as determined by the relevant national judicial or electoral authority.

title: Will the European Union implement blockchain technology in its election process by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements blockchain technology in any part of its election process for any of its member states or for EU-wide elections.

The implementation must be confirmed through an official announcement by the European Union or its relevant electoral body. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The blockchain technology must be used in a live election, not in a pilot or trial phase. The use of blockchain technology for voter registration, vote casting, vote counting, or any other critical part of the election process qualifies for this question's resolution.

In the event of partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or types of elections), the question will resolve as Yes if the implementation is intended for broader application in future elections.

title: Will any European Union country have a voter turnout exceeding 80% in a national election by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any European Union country reports a voter turnout exceeding 80% in a national election. 

A 'national election' refers to an election in which officials are elected to a national legislative body or the head of state (e.g., parliamentary or presidential elections).

Voter turnout is defined as the percentage of registered voters who cast a ballot, as reported by the country's official election authority. 

The turnout percentage must be reported by a credible and authoritative source, such as the country's national election commission or a reputable international organization (e.g., the European Union, United Nations, or Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe). 

In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of major international news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Canada host the FIFA World Cup before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Canada is officially announced as a host or co-host of the FIFA World Cup by FIFA.
The announcement must be confirmed by an official statement from FIFA or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
The hosting can be for either the men's or women's FIFA World Cup.
If Canada is announced as a co-host, the question will still resolve as Yes.
If no official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Canada and the United States enter into a new trade agreement by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Canada and the United States officially enter into a new trade agreement that meets the following criteria:

- The agreement must be formally signed by representatives of both countries and ratified by their respective legislative bodies.
- The agreement must be distinct from any existing trade agreements in place as of the date this question was posted.
- The agreement must cover at least two of the following areas: tariffs, trade in goods and services, intellectual property, labor standards, or environmental regulations.

Confirmation of the new trade agreement must come from official government announcements or documentation from both countries. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary or provisional agreements do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI that can autonomously conduct scientific research by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, DeepMind develops an AI system that can autonomously conduct scientific research. The AI must be able to independently generate hypotheses, design and conduct experiments, analyze data, and draw conclusions without human intervention. The AI's research must result in at least one peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific journal, where the AI is credited as the primary author. Confirmation of the AI's capabilities must come from an official announcement by DeepMind or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, etc.). If the AI system is only partially capable or requires significant human assistance, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Kingdom implement a nationwide quantum computing strategy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom has officially implemented a nationwide quantum computing strategy. This strategy must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation and must outline a comprehensive plan for the development, deployment, and integration of quantum computing technologies across various sectors, including but not limited to research, industry, and public services. The strategy must include specific goals, timelines, and allocated funding. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Partial or pilot implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new political party win a majority in the Swiss parliamentary elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a political party that did not have any seats in the Swiss Federal Assembly as of January 1, 2023, wins a majority of the seats in the National Council or the Council of States in a federal election. 

The majority is defined as more than 50% of the total seats in either the National Council or the Council of States. 

The results must be officially confirmed by the Swiss Federal Council or reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

In the event of a coalition, only the party with the highest number of seats within the coalition will be considered.

title: Will a new political party win a majority in the Spanish parliamentary elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a political party that did not have any seats in the Spanish Parliament (Cortes Generales) as of January 1, 2024, wins a majority of seats in the Spanish parliamentary elections.

A majority is defined as more than half of the total seats in the Congress of Deputies (currently 176 out of 350 seats).

The outcome must be confirmed by official election results released by the Spanish Ministry of the Interior or another authoritative government body.

In the event of a coalition government, this question will resolve as No unless a single new party, as defined above, wins a majority of seats on its own.

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI that can accurately predict natural disasters by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, DeepMind develops an artificial intelligence system that can accurately predict natural disasters such as earthquakes, hurricanes, or floods. The system must meet the following criteria:

- Accuracy: The AI must achieve a prediction accuracy rate of at least 85% for each type of natural disaster it is designed to predict.
- Verification: The accuracy of the AI's predictions must be verified by at least two independent scientific studies published in peer-reviewed journals.
- Deployment: The AI must be operationally deployed and used by at least one governmental or international agency responsible for disaster management or response.

The development and deployment of such an AI system must be confirmed by an official announcement from DeepMind or the deploying agency. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In the event that the AI system is only partially capable (e.g., it can predict some but not all types of natural disasters), the question will resolve as Yes if the system meets the accuracy and verification criteria for at least one type of natural disaster.

title: Will Ukraine regain full control of its territories currently occupied by Russia by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the Ukrainian government has regained full control over all territories that were occupied by Russia as of the resolution date of this question.

"Full control" is defined as:
- The Ukrainian government has established administrative and military control over the territories.
- No foreign military presence is operating in these territories without the explicit consent of the Ukrainian government.
- Ukrainian law is being enforced without significant opposition.

The resolution will be based on official announcements from the Ukrainian government or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the California state government introduce new policies related to Major League Baseball by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the California state government officially introduces new policies directly related to Major League Baseball (MLB). The policies must be enacted through legislation, executive order, or regulatory changes and must be publicly documented.

The new policies should specifically mention Major League Baseball or its operations within California. General sports policies that do not explicitly mention MLB will not be considered.

The introduction of such policies must be confirmed through official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policies must be in effect, not merely proposed or under discussion.

In case of ambiguity, the resolution will be based on the consensus of expert analysis from reputable sources.

title: Will Japan implement nationwide AI regulations by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Japan officially implements nationwide regulations specifically governing the development, deployment, and use of artificial intelligence technologies.

The regulations must be enacted through formal legislative or regulatory processes and must be applicable across the entire country.

The implementation of such regulations must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Regulations implemented at local or regional levels, or guidelines that are not legally binding, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Catalonia gain independence from Spain by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Catalonia officially gains independence from Spain. 

"Officially gains independence" is defined as:

- A declaration of independence by the Catalan government that is recognized by the Spanish government, or
- Recognition of Catalonia as an independent country by at least 50% of the member states of the United Nations, or
- Admission of Catalonia as a member state of the United Nations.

The resolution will be based on official announcements from the relevant governments or recognition by international bodies, such as the United Nations. In the absence of official announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient.

title: Will the outcome of the Russo-Ukrainian War influence the results of the 2028 Ukrainian presidential election?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, credible evidence demonstrates that the outcome of the Russo-Ukrainian War has had a significant influence on the results of the 2028 Ukrainian presidential election. "Significant influence" is defined as any of the following:
- A major shift in voter sentiment directly attributable to the war, as reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- An official statement from the Ukrainian government or the Central Election Commission of Ukraine attributing the election results to the war's outcome.
- Academic or expert analysis published in a peer-reviewed journal or by a recognized think tank concluding that the war's outcome was a decisive factor in the election.

In the absence of such evidence, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will advancements in quantum computing be used to secure voting systems by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a quantum computing-based system is officially used to secure any part of a voting system in a governmental election.
The system must be publicly acknowledged by the relevant electoral authority and reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
The use of quantum computing must be a key component in the security mechanism, such as encryption, voter authentication, or vote tallying.
Experimental or pilot projects do not count unless they are used in an actual governmental election.
In the event of multiple systems, the question resolves as Yes if at least one system meets the criteria.

title: Will a new information technology be implemented in national elections to improve transparency by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new information technology is officially implemented in any national election with the explicit purpose of improving transparency. The technology must meet the following criteria:

- Official Implementation: The technology must be officially adopted and used in at least one national election.
- Purpose: The primary purpose of the technology must be to improve transparency in the electoral process. This includes, but is not limited to, technologies for secure and transparent voting, real-time result reporting, or enhanced voter verification.
- Verification: The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question does not resolve based on trials, pilot programs, or proposals. The technology must be used in an actual national election.

title: Will any scientific research related to the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to a major breakthrough in natural sciences by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, scientific research directly related to the Russo-Ukrainian War leads to a major breakthrough in the natural sciences. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that meets the following criteria:

- Recognized by the scientific community as significantly advancing knowledge or technology in fields such as physics, chemistry, biology, earth sciences, or related disciplines.
- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of high repute (e.g., Nature, Science, The Lancet).
- Cited by at least 100 other scientific publications within two years of its initial publication.

The question resolves as YES if the breakthrough is confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) and recognized by a major scientific organization (e.g., National Academy of Sciences, Royal Society). If no such breakthrough is recognized by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Joe Biden endorse a major AI policy before the end of his current term in office?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before the end of Joe Biden's current term in office, he officially endorses a policy specifically focused on artificial intelligence (AI).

The endorsement must be in the form of a public announcement, official document, or policy statement explicitly supporting or outlining an AI-related strategy, regulation, or initiative. General mentions of AI in speeches or documents do not count unless they are part of a broader AI policy endorsement.

The endorsement must be reported by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) or documented in official government records. If Joe Biden's term ends prematurely, the question resolves based on the actions taken up to that date.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) propose significant AI regulations in their 2028 platform?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the official platform of the Democratic Party (US) for the 2028 election includes a proposal for significant AI regulations. 

"Significant AI regulations" are defined as policies that aim to govern the development, deployment, or use of artificial intelligence technologies. These policies must address at least one of the following areas:
- Ethical guidelines and standards for AI development and use.
- Data privacy and protection in the context of AI.
- AI accountability and transparency measures.
- Regulations on the use of AI in critical sectors such as healthcare, finance, and law enforcement.

The platform must be an official document released by the Democratic Party and available on their official website or through a formal announcement. In the event of ambiguity, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters) will be used to determine the presence of such proposals in the platform.

title: Will Switzerland join the European Union by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Switzerland has completed the process of joining the European Union. This includes the formal application, acceptance by the European Union, and the official ratification of membership by both Switzerland and the European Union.

The confirmation of Switzerland joining the EU must be verified through official announcements from the Swiss government and the European Union, or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of full ratification but with substantial progress, such as an official application and acceptance pending final ratification, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United States pass a federal data privacy law by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States Congress passes and the President signs into law a federal data privacy legislation that establishes comprehensive data privacy rights for individuals. 
The legislation must include, at a minimum, the following provisions:
- Rights for individuals to access, correct, and delete personal data held by companies.
- Requirements for companies to obtain explicit consent before collecting or sharing personal data.
- Provisions for data breach notifications.
- Enforcement mechanisms, including penalties for non-compliance.

The passage of the law must be confirmed by official government sources such as the U.S. Congress website or the White House. In the absence of official confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian) are sufficient.

In the event of multiple laws being passed, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets the above criteria. If no such law is passed, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will France hold a referendum on leaving the European Union by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, France holds a national referendum where the primary question asked is whether France should leave the European Union. The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the French government and conducted according to French electoral laws. The question will resolve as No if no such referendum is held by the specified date. In the event of ambiguity, the confirmation of the referendum being held must come from reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or official French government announcements.

title: Will machine learning algorithms achieve human-level performance in medical diagnosis by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, machine learning algorithms achieve human-level performance in medical diagnosis across a range of medical conditions.

The criteria for "human-level performance" are as follows:

- Accuracy: The machine learning algorithm must demonstrate diagnostic accuracy comparable to or exceeding that of a board-certified medical doctor in at least three distinct medical specialties (e.g., radiology, pathology, dermatology).
- Peer Review: The performance must be documented in at least two peer-reviewed journals or presented at major medical conferences.
- Clinical Trials: The algorithm must be validated through clinical trials or real-world clinical settings and show consistent results.
- Regulatory Approval: The algorithm must receive approval or clearance from at least one major regulatory body (e.g., FDA, EMA) for use in clinical settings.

In case of partial achievement (e.g., human-level performance in fewer than three specialties), the question will resolve as No. The use of machine learning algorithms as an assistive tool rather than as a primary diagnostic tool does not count towards this question's resolution.

Authoritative sources for verification include peer-reviewed scientific journals, major medical conferences, and announcements from regulatory bodies.

title: Will biotechnology advancements lead to the creation of fully synthetic organs by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, fully synthetic organs are created and meet the following criteria:

- Functionality: The synthetic organ must perform the same function as its natural counterpart in the human body.
- Biocompatibility: The synthetic organ must be biocompatible, causing no adverse immune response in the human body.
- Successful Implantation: The organ must be successfully implanted in a human patient and demonstrate normal function for at least six months post-implantation.

The creation and successful implantation must be verified by peer-reviewed publications or documented in credible medical journals. Confirmation from at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) is also required. In the absence of such publications, official announcements from recognized medical institutions or regulatory bodies (e.g., FDA, EMA) will suffice.

title: Will Taiwan hold a presidential election that is deemed free and fair by international observers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Taiwan holds a presidential election that is deemed free and fair by a consensus of international observers. 

"Free and fair" means that the election process, including voting and counting, is conducted without significant irregularities, fraud, or coercion, and that the results reflect the will of the voters.

The assessment must come from at least three reputable international organizations, such as the Carter Center, the European Union Election Observation Mission, and the International Republican Institute. 

If there is disagreement among observers, the resolution will be based on the majority opinion of these organizations. If no international observers are present, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will Japan's investment in renewable energy result in a 50% reduction in carbon emissions by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Japan's carbon emissions are reduced by at least 50% compared to the baseline year of 2020. The reduction must be directly attributable to investments in renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, and geothermal power.

The primary source for verification will be Japan's Ministry of the Environment or an equivalent authoritative body. In the absence of official government data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient.

The reduction must be demonstrated through comprehensive and transparent data, and the investments must be clearly linked to the observed reduction in emissions. Temporary reductions due to economic downturns, natural disasters, or other non-investment-related factors do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Iran's air quality improve by 50% by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Iran's air quality shows a 50% improvement based on the Air Quality Index (AQI) over the baseline average AQI measured in 2023.

The improvement must be confirmed by data from at least two of the following sources: Iran's Department of Environment, the World Health Organization (WHO), or a peer-reviewed scientific study.

The baseline AQI will be calculated as the average of daily AQI values across major cities in Iran (including Tehran, Mashhad, Isfahan, Karaj, Shiraz, and Tabriz) for the year 2023.

A 50% improvement means that the average AQI for the year 2027 must be at least 50% lower than the baseline AQI of 2023.

In case of discrepancies between sources, the median value will be considered.

If data is unavailable or insufficient to determine the resolution, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new species of mammal be discovered by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new species of mammal is discovered and officially recognized by the scientific community. The discovery must meet the following criteria:

- The species must be formally described in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- The description must include genetic analysis distinguishing the new species from all previously known species.
- The species must be recognized as valid by the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) or a similar authoritative body.

In the event of a dispute over the validity of the species, the question will remain unresolved until a consensus is reached within the scientific community or an authoritative body makes a final determination.

title: Will Germany experience a significant political shift (e.g., change in government or major policy reform) by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Germany experiences a significant political shift, defined as one of the following:

- Change in Government: A new political party or coalition takes control of the German federal government, resulting in a new Chancellor.
- Major Policy Reform: Implementation of a policy reform that significantly alters Germany's domestic or foreign policy, confirmed through legislation passed by the Bundestag and Bundesrat.

The change must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg). In the absence of such reports, official government announcements or documentation confirming the change are sufficient.

This question resolves as NO if none of the above criteria are met by the resolution date.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used to make significant discoveries related to black holes by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, artificial intelligence (AI) is used to make significant discoveries related to black holes, as evidenced by one or more of the following criteria:

- Publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of a discovery directly attributed to AI analysis or modeling that advances our understanding of black holes.
- Official announcements by reputable scientific organizations (e.g., NASA, ESA, or major research universities) crediting AI with a significant discovery regarding black holes.
- Coverage by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) reporting on the AI-driven discovery and its significance.

A "significant discovery" is defined as one that is widely recognized by the scientific community as advancing the understanding of black holes, such as new insights into their formation, behavior, or properties.

If there is any ambiguity or dispute over whether a discovery meets these criteria, the consensus of the scientific community will be used to determine the resolution.

title: Will the NBA introduce a mid-season tournament before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the National Basketball Association (NBA) officially introduces and conducts a mid-season tournament. The tournament must meet the following criteria:

- The tournament is held between the start and end of the regular NBA season.
- It involves all or a majority of NBA teams.
- The tournament results in a distinct championship or title separate from the NBA Finals.
- Official NBA documentation or announcements confirm the tournament's introduction and execution.

The question will resolve as No if no such tournament is introduced and conducted by the specified date, or if the tournament is canceled before completion.

title: Will Taiwan establish a new national park or significant conservation area by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Taiwan officially establishes a new national park or a significant conservation area. The establishment must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation from the Taiwanese government.

A 'significant conservation area' is defined as a protected area of at least 10,000 hectares dedicated to the preservation of biodiversity, ecosystems, and natural resources. The area must be designated for long-term conservation purposes and recognized by an authoritative conservation organization such as the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN).

The announcement must be covered by at least two major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) or published in an official government gazette. Temporary designations or areas established for purposes other than conservation do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Microsoft develop a significant new technology for environmental monitoring by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Microsoft officially announces and releases a new technology specifically designed for environmental monitoring that meets the following criteria:

- The technology must be innovative and represent a significant advancement over existing solutions in the field of environmental monitoring.
- It must be capable of collecting, analyzing, and reporting environmental data (such as air quality, water quality, deforestation, or climate change metrics) with a high degree of accuracy and reliability.
- The technology must be recognized as significant by at least three reputable sources, such as major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or scientific journals.

The question will resolve as No if no such technology is announced and released by the specified date.

title: Will the United Nations implement a global cybersecurity policy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations officially implements a global cybersecurity policy. 

The policy must meet the following criteria:
- Be formally adopted by the United Nations General Assembly or Security Council.
- Include specific measures for international cooperation on cybersecurity issues, such as information sharing, incident response coordination, and capacity building.
- Be publicly accessible and documented in official UN records.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary or non-binding resolutions, or policies limited to specific regions or member states, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant natural sciences discovery related to Sweden by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant discovery in the natural sciences is made and is directly related to Sweden. A 'significant discovery' is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and recognized as a major advancement by the scientific community.
- Awarded a major scientific prize (e.g., Nobel Prize, Breakthrough Prize).
- Recognized by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) as a groundbreaking discovery.

The discovery must have a clear and direct connection to Sweden, either through the location of the research, the nationality of the lead scientist(s), or the primary affiliation of the research institution(s).

title: Will a Swedish scientist win a Nobel Prize in Chemistry by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a scientist of Swedish nationality is announced as a Nobel Prize winner in Chemistry. The nationality of the scientist will be determined based on the official Nobel Prize announcement and accompanying documentation. If the prize is awarded to a team, at least one member must be of Swedish nationality for the question to resolve as Yes. The Nobel Prize in Chemistry must be recognized by the official Nobel Prize organization (Nobelprize.org).

title: Will China become the world's largest economy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, China is recognized as the world's largest economy based on any of the following metrics:

- Gross Domestic Product (GDP) in nominal terms, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank.
- Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) GDP, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank.

The determination must be based on official reports published by the IMF or the World Bank. In the absence of such reports, credible reports from at least three major financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times, The Wall Street Journal) will be considered.

In case of conflicting data, the question will resolve based on the majority consensus among the sources mentioned above.

title: Will the European Union implement a unified military force by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements a unified military force. The criteria for a unified military force are as follows:

- The force must be established by an official EU directive or treaty ratified by all member states.
- The force must operate under a single command structure that is distinct from individual member states' military forces.
- The force must be capable of independent military operations, including deployment, logistics, and command and control.

The implementation must be confirmed by official EU documentation or announcements. In the absence of such documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary coalitions or joint exercises do not count towards this question's resolution. The force must be a permanent and standing military entity.

title: Will a new geopolitical alliance involving at least three countries be formed by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new geopolitical alliance involving at least three countries is officially formed and announced. 

The alliance must be formalized through a treaty, agreement, or official declaration, and must be recognized by the governments of the member countries. 

The formation of the alliance must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

The alliance must have a defined purpose, such as military cooperation, economic collaboration, or political partnership. 

Temporary coalitions for specific events or informal agreements do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Russia implement online voting in national elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Russian government officially implements an online voting system for national elections. The system must be available for use by the general population in at least one national election (presidential or parliamentary).

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The system must be operational and not in a pilot or trial phase. Temporary implementations for specific events or limited use in regional or local elections do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States implement a nationwide universal healthcare system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States implements a universal healthcare system that meets the following criteria:

- Coverage: The system must provide healthcare coverage to all U.S. residents, regardless of income, employment status, or pre-existing conditions.
- Legislation: The implementation must be enacted through federal legislation, signed into law by the President, and come into effect by the resolution date.
- Services: The system must include primary, preventive, and emergency medical services.
- Verification: The implementation must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian) are sufficient.

The question resolves as No if such a system is not implemented by the resolution date, or if the system is only partially implemented or limited to specific states.

title: Will Catalonia hold a legally recognized independence referendum by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Catalonia holds an independence referendum that meets the following criteria:

- Legally Recognized: The referendum must be officially recognized by the Spanish government or an authoritative international body such as the United Nations or the European Union.
- Public Vote: The referendum must involve a public vote open to the eligible voting population of Catalonia.
- Independence Question: The referendum must explicitly ask voters whether Catalonia should become an independent country, separate from Spain.

Confirmation of the referendum's legal recognition must come from official announcements by the Spanish government or authoritative international bodies. Reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are also acceptable.

If no such referendum is held by the resolution date, this question resolves as No.

title: Will Donald Trump launch a tech startup focused on AI or quantum computing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Donald Trump launches a tech startup that is publicly stated to focus primarily on artificial intelligence (AI) or quantum computing.

The startup must be registered as a business entity, and there must be a formal announcement or documentation indicating its focus on AI or quantum computing. The announcement can come from Donald Trump himself, a spokesperson, or official company communications.

Verification will rely on reputable news sources, such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or official government or business registration records. If no such announcement or documentation is found by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will France achieve its goal of reducing carbon emissions by 40% from 1990 levels by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, France achieves a reduction in carbon emissions by 40% from 1990 levels. 

The official measurement of carbon emissions must be reported by France's Ministry of Ecological Transition or an equivalent authoritative body. The reduction must be confirmed in official government documentation or reports. 

In the absence of official government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The reduction must be in line with international standards for measuring carbon emissions. Temporary reductions due to extraordinary circumstances (e.g., natural disasters, pandemics) will not count unless they are part of a sustained, long-term trend.

title: Will Google develop a quantum computer that demonstrates clear advantages over classical computers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google develops a quantum computer that demonstrates clear advantages over classical computers in solving at least one practical problem. The demonstration of advantage must meet the following criteria:

1. Performance: The quantum computer must solve a problem faster or more efficiently than the best-known classical algorithm for the same problem.

2. Practical Problem: The problem solved must have practical applications in fields such as cryptography, optimization, material science, or any other domain where quantum computing is expected to have an impact.

3. Verification: The performance and practical advantage must be verified by independent experts in the field and documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or confirmed by a major conference presentation.

4. Public Announcement: Google must officially announce the achievement, or it must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

In the event of a partial achievement, where the quantum computer shows advantages in limited or specific cases, the question will resolve as Yes only if the achievement is recognized as a significant milestone by the scientific community.

title: Will Donald Trump run for the US Congress by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Donald Trump officially files as a candidate to run for a seat in the US Congress (either the House of Representatives or the Senate).
The filing must be confirmed by official government records or announcements. In the absence of official confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.
If Donald Trump announces an intention to run but does not officially file, this question resolves as No.
If Donald Trump files to run for a different office (e.g., President, Governor), this question resolves as No.

title: Will North Korea launch a satellite for scientific research purposes by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, North Korea successfully launches a satellite specifically for scientific research purposes.

The satellite must be designed primarily for scientific research, such as Earth observation, space science, or atmospheric studies, rather than for military or communication purposes. The launch must be confirmed by an official announcement from the North Korean government or verified by credible reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

The satellite must reach its intended orbit and be operational. In the event of multiple launches, only the first successful launch will be considered for this question's resolution.

title: Will an AI algorithm predict the value of the US dollar with over 95% accuracy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI algorithm is developed that can predict the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies (including but not limited to the Euro, Japanese Yen, British Pound, and Swiss Franc) with an accuracy of at least 95% over a period of at least one year.

The accuracy must be validated by an independent financial or academic institution, such as the Federal Reserve, European Central Bank, or a top-tier university's economics department.

The prediction accuracy should be based on daily closing values and must account for at least 95% of the variance (R^2 ≥ 0.95) in the actual values over the specified period.

Reports or claims by the developing entity alone are not sufficient; independent verification and publication in a peer-reviewed financial or economic journal are required. In case of multiple claims, the first verified instance will be considered for resolution.

Temporary or short-term predictions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States implement regulations on AI technologies developed by OpenAI before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the United States government officially implements regulations specifically targeting AI technologies developed by OpenAI. The regulations must be enacted through federal legislation, executive orders, or formal regulatory agency rules explicitly mentioning OpenAI or its AI technologies.

The implementation of such regulations must be confirmed by official government documentation or announcements. In the absence of official documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) are sufficient.

Regulations that apply generally to all AI technologies or companies, without specifically targeting OpenAI, do not count towards this question's resolution. The regulations must be in effect, not merely proposed or under consideration.

title: Will North Korea conduct a successful intercontinental ballistic missile test by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, North Korea successfully conducts an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) test that meets the following criteria:

- The missile must travel a minimum distance of 5,500 kilometers (3,418 miles).
- The missile must be launched from North Korean territory and reach its intended target area without any major malfunctions or deviations from its planned trajectory.
