- The success of the test must be confirmed by at least three credible sources, such as major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) or official government statements from countries with satellite monitoring capabilities (e.g., the United States, South Korea, Japan).

In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the majority of credible sources.

title: Will the European Union expand to include more than 30 member states by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union (EU) officially expands to include more than 30 member states. The official expansion must be confirmed by an announcement from the European Union or documentation from an official EU source. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary or provisional memberships do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will China implement a nationwide policy on AI ethics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the government of China officially implements a nationwide policy specifically focused on AI ethics.

The policy must include guidelines or regulations addressing ethical considerations in the development, deployment, and use of artificial intelligence technologies.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Local or regional policies, or policies that do not specifically focus on AI ethics, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a geopolitical event lead to the relocation of an MLB team by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a Major League Baseball (MLB) team relocates due to a geopolitical event. A 'geopolitical event' is defined as an event involving political, economic, or military actions between two or more countries that significantly impacts the team's ability to operate in its current location.

The relocation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the MLB or the team itself. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary relocations (e.g., for a season) do not count; the relocation must be intended as permanent. The question resolves as No if no such relocation occurs by the specified date.

title: Will Gavin Newsom win the California gubernatorial election in 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Gavin Newsom is declared the winner of the California gubernatorial election in 2028.

The declaration must be made by the California Secretary of State, who is the authoritative source for election results in California.

In the event of a recount or legal challenge, the resolution will be based on the final certified result as announced by the California Secretary of State.

If Gavin Newsom is unable to complete the campaign due to unforeseen circumstances, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the 2028 United States presidential election have a voter turnout higher than 60%?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the official voter turnout for the 2028 United States presidential election is greater than 60%. The official voter turnout is defined as the percentage of eligible voters who cast a ballot in the election.

The official source for this data will be the United States Federal Election Commission (FEC). If the FEC does not provide the data by the resolution date, reputable sources such as the United States Census Bureau or major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian) will be used.

In the event of discrepancies between sources, the FEC data will take precedence. If FEC data is unavailable, the majority consensus among the other sources will be used.

title: Will the European Union implement new regulations on genetically modified organisms (GMOs) by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements new regulations specifically targeting genetically modified organisms (GMOs).

The new regulations must be confirmed through an official announcement in the Official Journal of the European Union or through a press release from the European Commission.

The regulations must be distinct from any amendments to existing policies and should include at least one of the following:

- New labeling requirements for GMO products;
- New safety or environmental impact assessments for GMO products;
- New restrictions or bans on specific GMO products or practices.

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If no new regulations are implemented by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a quantum computer solve a problem currently intractable for classical computers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a quantum computer successfully solves a problem that is currently considered intractable for classical computers. The criteria for intractability are:

- The problem must be one that is widely recognized in the computational complexity community as intractable for classical computers, such as those in the complexity class NP-hard or beyond.
- The solution must be verified and accepted by at least two independent experts in the field of quantum computing.
- The results must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.

In the event of any ambiguity, the resolution will be based on a consensus of experts in the field, with a fallback to a review by a panel of at least three independent experts if no consensus can be reached.

title: Will the US dollar be replaced as the world's primary reserve currency by a digital currency by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a digital currency becomes the primary reserve currency of the world, replacing the US dollar. 

A "digital currency" is defined as a form of currency that is available only in digital or electronic form, and not in physical form such as paper money or coins. This includes cryptocurrencies, central bank digital currencies (CBDCs), and other forms of digital assets. 

"Primary reserve currency" is defined as the currency that is held in significant quantities by governments and institutions as part of their foreign exchange reserves and is widely used in international trade and finance. 

The determination will be based on reports from at least three of the following reputable sources: 
- International Monetary Fund (IMF)
- Bank for International Settlements (BIS)
- World Bank
- Financial Times
- Bloomberg
- Reuters
- The Wall Street Journal

In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve as Yes if a majority of the sources listed above agree that a digital currency has replaced the US dollar as the primary reserve currency.

title: Will Japan hold a national referendum on constitutional revision before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Japan holds a national referendum specifically addressing constitutional revision. The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the Japanese government and its primary purpose must be the amendment or revision of one or more articles of the Japanese Constitution. 

The announcement of the referendum must be confirmed by an official government declaration or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (NHK, Asahi Shimbun, The Japan Times, Reuters) are sufficient. 

If the referendum is postponed or canceled, or if the referendum addresses issues other than constitutional revision, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will Emmanuel Macron still be the President of France in 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Emmanuel Macron is the President of France at any point on December 31, 2027. 
Official confirmation must come from a reputable source such as the official French government website, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, or Washington Post. 
If Macron resigns, is impeached, or otherwise leaves office before this date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Amazon be involved in the development of any election-related technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Amazon is confirmed to be involved in the development of any technology specifically designed for use in elections. This includes, but is not limited to, electronic voting systems, voter registration systems, election security technologies, and election result reporting systems. 

The involvement must be publicly acknowledged by Amazon through an official statement or press release. Alternatively, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The technology must be intended for use in official governmental elections. Technology developed for private organizations or non-governmental elections does not count. 

If Amazon's involvement is limited to providing general-purpose technology (e.g., cloud services) without specific modifications or applications for elections, this question resolves as No.

title: Will France develop a government-backed AI research lab by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the French government officially establishes and backs a research laboratory dedicated to artificial intelligence (AI). The lab must meet the following criteria:

- Official Government Backing: The lab must be publicly announced and funded by the French government.
- Dedicated to AI: The primary focus of the lab must be on AI research and development.
- Operational Status: The lab must be operational and conducting research, not merely announced or in the planning stages.

Verification will be based on an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Le Monde) are sufficient.

title: Will NATO countries collectively invest over $10 billion in AI research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, NATO countries collectively invest over $10 billion in AI research. The following criteria must be met:

1. The investment must be officially announced by NATO or its member countries' government bodies.
2. The investment can be in the form of direct funding, grants, or contracts specifically earmarked for AI research.
3. The total investment amount will be calculated in USD, based on official exchange rates at the time of the announcement.
4. Credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the investment amount.

In case of partial or ambiguous announcements, the question will resolve as Yes if the cumulative total of confirmed investments meets or exceeds $10 billion USD.

title: Will China implement online voting for its citizens by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the People's Republic of China officially implements an online voting system that allows its citizens to cast votes in national-level elections through the internet. The system must be officially announced and documented by the Chinese government and must be used in at least one national-level election. Credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the implementation and use of the system are sufficient in the absence of an official announcement. Trials or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a candidate with a background in Medicine be elected to a national office in any European Union country by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a candidate with a background in Medicine is elected to a national office in any European Union country. 

A "background in Medicine" is defined as having a degree in Medicine (MD or equivalent) and/or having practiced as a medical doctor. 

"National office" refers to positions such as President, Prime Minister, or any other equivalent head of state or head of government roles, as well as members of the national legislature (e.g., Parliament, National Assembly, etc.). 

The election must be confirmed by official election results from the respective country's electoral authority. In the absence of official confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

title: Will India implement a nationwide AI-driven public transportation system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, India has officially implemented a nationwide public transportation system that is driven by artificial intelligence. 

The system must be operational across multiple states and capable of managing and optimizing routes, schedules, and vehicle dispatching autonomously. 

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The system must be fully operational, not in a trial or pilot phase. Temporary implementations or systems limited to a single city or region do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Taiwan implement a nationwide AI strategy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Taiwan officially implements a nationwide AI strategy. The strategy must be a formal, government-endorsed plan or policy aimed at promoting and regulating the development and use of artificial intelligence across the country. The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The strategy must cover multiple sectors such as healthcare, education, transportation, and public safety. Temporary pilot programs or sector-specific initiatives do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the European Union implement a unified digital currency by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements a unified digital currency that is adopted by at least 60% of its member countries. 
The digital currency must be issued or backed by the European Central Bank (ECB) and be legally recognized for transactions within adopting member states. 
The implementation must be confirmed through an official announcement by the European Central Bank or the European Commission. 
In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 
The currency must be operational and not in a trial or pilot phase. 
If the currency is implemented but only in a limited capacity (e.g., for specific types of transactions or within certain regions), the question will resolve as Yes if there is a clear and official plan for full adoption across the adopting member states.

title: Will the United Kingdom hold a second referendum on Scottish independence by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a second referendum on Scottish independence is held in the United Kingdom. 

A "second referendum on Scottish independence" is defined as any official public vote sanctioned by the UK government or the Scottish Parliament where the electorate is asked to vote on whether Scotland should become an independent country, following the initial referendum held in 2014. 

The referendum must be officially recognized and the results must be officially counted and reported by the relevant electoral authorities. 

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the event. 

If the referendum is annulled or the results are declared invalid for any reason, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new global health treaty be signed by major world powers by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a new global health treaty is signed by at least three of the following major world powers by December 31, 2028: the United States, China, Russia, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Japan, or India. The treaty must be aimed at addressing global health issues, such as pandemics, infectious diseases, or health inequities, and must be officially recognized and documented by the World Health Organization (WHO) or another reputable international health organization. The signing must be confirmed by official government announcements or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). If the treaty is signed but not yet ratified, this still counts towards the resolution of this question.

title: Will the US House of Representatives elections in 2028 see a voter turnout greater than 60%?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the voter turnout for the US House of Representatives elections in 2028 exceeds 60% of the eligible voting population.

The following sources will be used to verify the voter turnout:
- Official data from the United States Election Assistance Commission (EAC).
- In the absence of EAC data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Associated Press, CNN) will be considered.

The eligible voting population is defined as all US citizens who meet the requirements to vote as of the date of the election. The voter turnout percentage will be calculated based on the total number of votes cast in the US House of Representatives elections divided by the total number of eligible voters.

If there is any ambiguity or dispute regarding the turnout percentage, the final determination will be based on the consensus of the majority of the sources listed above.

title: Will a new food labeling regulation be introduced by the Food and Drug Administration before 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially introduces a new food labeling regulation. The regulation must be announced on the FDA's official website or through an official FDA press release. The regulation must pertain directly to food labeling standards, requirements, or guidelines. Amendments to existing regulations count towards this question's resolution if they introduce significant changes to labeling practices. Temporary guidelines or recommendations do not count. Verification will be based on the official announcement date.

title: Will any country hold an election using a blockchain-based voting system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any country holds a national election in which votes are cast and recorded using a blockchain-based voting system.

A 'blockchain-based voting system' is defined as a voting system that leverages blockchain technology to securely record votes in a decentralized ledger, ensuring transparency and immutability.

The election must be a national election, such as a presidential, parliamentary, or equivalent election, and must be officially recognized by the country's electoral authority.

The use of blockchain technology must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Partial implementations, such as pilot programs or regional elections, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a formal peace treaty signed to end the Russo-Ukrainian War by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a formal peace treaty is signed by the recognized governments of both Russia and Ukraine, officially ending the Russo-Ukrainian War.

The peace treaty must be publicly announced and documented by both governments. Verification will be based on official government statements and documentation, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

In the event of a ceasefire or armistice that does not result in a formal peace treaty, this question will resolve as No. Similarly, any agreements that are not recognized as a formal peace treaty by both governments will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will renewable energy sources account for more than 50% of the United States' energy consumption by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, renewable energy sources account for more than 50% of the total energy consumption in the United States. Renewable energy sources include solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass. The measurement should be based on data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) or an equivalent authoritative source. If the EIA or an equivalent authoritative source reports that renewable energy sources accounted for more than 50% of the total energy consumption in any of their annual reports for the year 2028, the question will resolve as Yes. In the absence of data from the EIA, reports from at least three credible news organizations (such as The New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg, or BBC) confirming this will be sufficient. This question resolves as NO if the criteria are not met by the specified date.

title: Will Italy hold a national election before the end of 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Italy holds a national election before December 31, 2028. A national election refers to any election in which members of the national legislature or the head of state are selected. The election must be officially recognized by the Italian government and reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Sweden achieve its carbon neutrality goal by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Sweden officially announces that it has achieved carbon neutrality. 

"Carbon neutrality" is defined as the country having net-zero carbon dioxide emissions, meaning that any carbon dioxide emissions are balanced by equivalent carbon dioxide removal or offset measures. 

The announcement must come from an official government source, such as a statement from the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency or the Ministry of the Environment. 

In the absence of an official government announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If there are conflicting reports or ambiguity about the achievement of carbon neutrality, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the United Nations adopt a global treaty on plastic pollution by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations officially adopts a global treaty specifically aimed at addressing plastic pollution.

The treaty must include commitments from member states to take specific actions to reduce plastic pollution, such as reducing plastic production, improving waste management, or mitigating plastic waste in oceans and other environments.

The adoption of the treaty must be confirmed by an official announcement from the United Nations or its relevant bodies. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The treaty must be a formal and binding agreement, not merely a declaration of intent or a non-binding resolution.

title: Will Brazil achieve a 50% reduction in deforestation rates in the Amazon by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Brazil achieves a 50% reduction in deforestation rates in the Amazon Rainforest compared to the average annual deforestation rate from 2015 to 2020.

The deforestation rates will be measured using data from authoritative sources such as the National Institute for Space Research (INPE) or the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO). The reduction must be sustained for at least one full calendar year.

In case of conflicting reports, a consensus from at least three major reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered. Temporary reductions due to unusual events (e.g., natural disasters) will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States achieve exascale computing capabilities by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States has officially achieved exascale computing capabilities. Exascale computing is defined as a system capable of performing at least one exaFLOP, or a billion billion (10^18) calculations per second. The achievement must be confirmed through an official announcement from a reputable authority such as the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) or the National Science Foundation (NSF). In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational and not in a trial or testing phase. If multiple systems achieve this capability, the question resolves as Yes upon the first confirmed instance.

title: Will any NATO member invoke Article 5 before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, any NATO member state invokes Article 5 of the North Atlantic Treaty.

Article 5 states that an armed attack against one or more NATO members is considered an attack against them all, and it allows member states to take necessary actions, including the use of armed force, to restore and maintain security.

The invocation of Article 5 must be confirmed by an official NATO statement or documentation. In the absence of an official statement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient.

Temporary measures, joint military exercises, or actions taken under different articles of the NATO treaty do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Brazil have a new president before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Brazil officially inaugurates a new president who was not the incumbent as of the date this question was posted.

The new president must be officially recognized by the Brazilian government and confirmed by reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of the current president's resignation, impeachment, death, or any other scenario leading to the appointment of a new president, the question will resolve as Yes upon the official swearing-in of the new president.

If no new president is inaugurated by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Canada join a new international alliance before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Canada officially joins a new international alliance. 
An 'international alliance' is defined as a formal agreement between two or more countries for mutual support in areas such as defense, trade, or other significant policy areas. 
The alliance must be newly established, meaning it did not exist in its current form before the resolution date. 
Canada's membership must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. 
In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.
The alliance must be recognized by the international community, and not merely a bilateral agreement or an extension of an existing alliance.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration implement new regulations on lab-grown meat by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA) implements new regulations specifically addressing the production, sale, or labeling of lab-grown meat.

The criteria for implementation include:
- The publication of the new regulations in the Federal Register.
- An official announcement by the FDA regarding the new regulations.

The new regulations must be distinct from any existing regulations and specifically target lab-grown meat, not general food safety standards. The question will resolve as No if no such regulations are implemented by the resolution date.

In the event of ambiguity, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian) confirming the implementation will be considered sufficient.

title: Will advancements in Information Technology play a crucial role in the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, advancements in Information Technology (IT) are widely recognized by reputable sources as having played a crucial role in the 2028 elections. 

"Advancements in Information Technology" refers to significant developments or innovations in areas such as (but not limited to) artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, data analytics, blockchain, and digital communication platforms. 

A "crucial role" means that these advancements had a substantial and widely acknowledged impact on the election process, including but not limited to voting procedures, election security, voter engagement, or the dissemination of information.

The determination of whether IT advancements played a crucial role will be based on reports from at least three major and reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of consensus among these sources, the question will resolve as No.

Edge cases, such as minor technological improvements or isolated incidents, will not be considered sufficient for a Yes resolution.

title: Will the United Nations establish a new member state by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new member state is officially admitted to the United Nations. Admission is confirmed by an official announcement from the United Nations General Assembly or Security Council. The new member state must be recognized by a majority vote in the General Assembly following the recommendation of the Security Council. In the event of ambiguous situations, such as partial recognition or observer status, the question will resolve as No unless full membership is granted.

title: Will Google face antitrust regulations in the European Union by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Google is subject to any new antitrust regulations enacted by the European Union. 

Antitrust regulations are defined as laws or regulations intended to promote competition and prevent monopolistic practices. This includes, but is not limited to, measures such as breaking up the company, imposing significant fines specifically for antitrust violations, or enforcing structural changes to Google's business operations in the European Union.

The enactment of such regulations must be confirmed through an official announcement from the European Commission or other relevant EU regulatory bodies. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question will resolve as No if no new antitrust regulations are enacted by the specified date, or if existing regulations are merely enforced without any new laws or regulations being introduced.

title: Will Microsoft establish a new headquarters in a European country by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Microsoft officially establishes a new headquarters in any European country. The establishment must be confirmed through an official announcement by Microsoft or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The headquarters must be intended for long-term operations and not be a temporary or satellite office. The question resolves as No if no such headquarters is established and confirmed by the resolution date.

title: Will a new variant of COVID-19 with a higher fatality rate than the original strain emerge before 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a new variant of COVID-19 is identified and confirmed to have a higher fatality rate than the original strain (SARS-CoV-2) identified in Wuhan, China in December 2019. The higher fatality rate must be confirmed through peer-reviewed research published in a reputable scientific journal or official statements from recognized health organizations such as the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The fatality rate should be measured as the proportion of deaths among confirmed cases (case fatality rate). In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus of the scientific community will be used to determine the resolution. If no such variant is identified and confirmed by December 31, 2027, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new form of renewable energy become the primary source of energy in any country by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new form of renewable energy becomes the primary source of energy in any country. For the purposes of this question, a 'new form of renewable energy' is defined as a renewable energy source that was not commercially viable or widely used before January 1, 2023. 'Primary source of energy' means that the new form of renewable energy accounts for the largest share of energy production in the country, surpassing all other sources.

The determination of the primary source of energy must be based on official government energy reports or data from reputable international organizations such as the International Energy Agency (IEA) or the United Nations (UN). If such data is not available, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient.

In the event of a tie between multiple energy sources, the question will resolve as Yes if the new form of renewable energy is one of the tied sources. This question will resolve as No if no new form of renewable energy meets these criteria by the resolution date.

title: Will Israel and Palestine reach a peace agreement by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Israel and Palestine officially sign a peace agreement recognized by both parties and the international community. The agreement must address key issues such as borders, the status of Jerusalem, security arrangements, and the rights of refugees. Confirmation of the agreement must come from official announcements by both the Israeli and Palestinian governments, and be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve as Yes if the majority of the aforementioned news organizations confirm the agreement. Temporary ceasefires or partial agreements that do not comprehensively address the key issues will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the total number of operational satellites exceed 15,000 by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the total number of operational satellites in Earth's orbit exceeds 15,000. 

An operational satellite is defined as a satellite that is actively functioning and performing its intended mission, whether it be for communication, navigation, Earth observation, or scientific research. 

The count of operational satellites will be based on data from authoritative sources such as the Union of Concerned Scientists (UCS) Satellite Database, the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA), or reports from major space agencies like NASA, ESA, or commercial satellite operators. 

In the event of discrepancies between sources, the highest reported number will be used for resolution. Temporary malfunctions that are resolved within 30 days do not disqualify a satellite from being considered operational.

title: Will the United States have a female president by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a female individual is inaugurated as President of the United States by December 31, 2028. The individual must be officially recognized as female at the time of inauguration. The inauguration must be confirmed by official government records or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the European Union implement a unified digital identity system by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union has officially implemented a unified digital identity system accessible to all its member states' citizens. The system must allow for secure identification and authentication of individuals across various services and platforms, both public and private, within the EU. The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the European Commission or another relevant EU authority. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be fully operational, not in a pilot or trial phase. Partial implementations or systems limited to specific member states do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland develop a new cryptographic algorithm that becomes a global standard by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a cryptographic algorithm developed in Switzerland becomes a global standard. 

"Global standard" is defined as an algorithm that is adopted by at least three major international standards organizations (e.g., ISO, IEEE, IETF) or is widely implemented in major cryptographic libraries (e.g., OpenSSL, Bouncy Castle) and used in commercial products by at least five major multinational companies (e.g., Microsoft, Google, Apple, IBM, Amazon).

The algorithm must be publicly documented and verifiable through official publications or announcements from the relevant standards organizations or companies. 

In case of ambiguity, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be used to determine the resolution. 

The algorithm must be developed primarily in Switzerland, with at least 50% of the lead researchers or developers being affiliated with Swiss institutions or companies.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration approve a revolutionary drug for a major disease based on natural science research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approves a drug that meets the following criteria: 
- The drug must be classified as 'revolutionary,' meaning it offers a significant improvement over existing treatments for a major disease (e.g., cancer, Alzheimer's, diabetes).
- The drug's development must be primarily based on research in natural sciences (e.g., biology, chemistry, biochemistry).

Approval must be confirmed by an official FDA announcement. The drug must be available to the public and not just in experimental or limited-use stages. 

In the absence of an official FDA announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be sufficient to resolve this question as Yes.

If the drug is conditionally approved but later revoked or not fully approved by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will any country hold a referendum on the use of genetic editing in humans for medical purposes by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any country officially holds a referendum on the use of genetic editing in humans for medical purposes. 

The referendum must be nationwide and officially sanctioned by the government. The genetic editing in question must pertain to medical purposes, including but not limited to, treatment or prevention of diseases and genetic disorders. 

The holding of the referendum must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

If the referendum is postponed or cancelled after being officially announced, the question will still resolve as Yes if the official announcement was made before the resolution date.

title: Will a new political party gain a majority in the US House of Representatives by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a political party other than the Democratic Party or the Republican Party gains a majority in the US House of Representatives. 

A "majority" is defined as holding more than half of the total 435 seats in the House of Representatives. 

The party must be officially recognized as a distinct political entity by the Federal Election Commission (FEC). 

The resolution will be based on the official results published by the Clerk of the House of Representatives following the 2028 general elections or any subsequent special elections that lead to a change in majority control.

title: Will Switzerland implement a nationwide AI-driven energy management system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland has officially implemented a nationwide energy management system driven by artificial intelligence.

The system must meet the following criteria:

- Nationwide Scope: The system must be operational across the entire country, not limited to specific regions or cities.
- AI-Driven: The system must utilize artificial intelligence for real-time monitoring, optimization, and management of energy resources.
- Official Implementation: The deployment must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice.
- Operational Status: The system must be fully operational, not in a trial or pilot phase. Temporary or event-specific implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States achieve a 50% reduction in energy consumption through AI optimization by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States achieves a 50% reduction in energy consumption compared to its energy consumption as of January 1, 2024, through the use of AI optimization techniques. 

The reduction must be documented and attributed primarily to AI optimization by an official government report or documentation from the U.S. Department of Energy. Alternatively, confirmation can come from credible reports by at least three major news organizations (e.g., The New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

AI optimization techniques refer to artificial intelligence methods used to analyze, predict, and optimize energy consumption and efficiency in various sectors, including but not limited to residential, commercial, and industrial sectors.

In the event of partial achievement, such as a reduction of less than 50%, or if the reduction cannot be primarily attributed to AI optimization, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new engineering project aimed at connecting two countries be completed by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an engineering project aimed at physically connecting two countries is officially completed. The project must involve the construction of infrastructure such as a bridge, tunnel, or similar structure that allows for continuous travel between the two countries.

The completion of the project must be confirmed by an official announcement from the governments of the connected countries or the organization responsible for the project. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice.

The project must be fully operational and open for public use. Temporary structures, projects still under construction, or those only partially operational will not count towards this resolution.

title: Will a new international treaty on chemical weapons be signed by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new international treaty specifically addressing the regulation, reduction, or elimination of chemical weapons is signed by at least two recognized sovereign states.

The treaty must be formally signed, not just agreed upon in principle or verbally. The signing must be confirmed by official government announcements or documentation from the involved countries, or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

The treaty must be new and not a mere amendment or extension of an existing treaty. If multiple treaties are signed, the first one to meet the criteria will be considered for resolution. The question resolves as No if no such treaty is signed by the specified date.

title: Will South Korea elect its first female president by the end of 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a female candidate is officially declared the winner of the South Korean presidential election by the National Election Commission of South Korea. The candidate must be inaugurated as the President of South Korea for the resolution to be considered valid. In the event of an election dispute or recount, the final decision by the National Election Commission will be used for resolution. News reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the election and inauguration are also sufficient for resolution.

title: Will a groundbreaking discovery in particle physics be made by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a groundbreaking discovery in particle physics is announced and recognized by the scientific community. The discovery must meet at least one of the following criteria:

- Discovery of a new fundamental particle that is not part of the Standard Model.
- Experimental confirmation of a theoretical prediction that significantly alters our understanding of particle physics.
- Detection of phenomena that cannot be explained by current particle physics theories and that lead to new theoretical developments.

The discovery must be confirmed by at least one of the following authoritative sources: CERN, Fermilab, or a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal such as Physical Review Letters, Nature, or Science. Additionally, the discovery must be widely recognized by the scientific community, as evidenced by coverage in major scientific news outlets or endorsements by leading physicists.

If there is any ambiguity or dispute regarding the significance of the discovery, the question will resolve based on the consensus of a panel of experts from leading institutions in the field of particle physics.

title: Will a new political party focused on medicine and healthcare emerge in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new political party primarily focused on medicine and healthcare is officially registered and recognized in the United States. The party must meet the following criteria:

- Official Registration: The party must be officially registered with the Federal Election Commission (FEC) as a national political party.
- Primary Focus: The party's platform, as stated in its official documentation, must primarily focus on issues related to medicine and healthcare.
- Public Activity: The party must have engaged in public political activities, such as running candidates in federal elections or organizing national campaigns related to its platform.

Confirmation of the party's registration and activities must come from reputable sources such as official government announcements or documentation, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian).

title: Will global average temperatures increase by more than 1.5°C compared to pre-industrial levels by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the global average temperature has increased by more than 1.5°C compared to pre-industrial levels (defined as the average temperature over the period 1850-1900). The primary source for temperature data will be the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) or the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC). If both sources provide data, the WMO data will take precedence. If neither organization provides the necessary data, the question will resolve based on the consensus of at least three reputable scientific institutions (e.g., NASA, NOAA, Hadley Centre). In case of conflicting data, the question will resolve based on the majority agreement among these sources.

title: Will a new exoplanet capable of supporting life be discovered by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new exoplanet is discovered that meets the following criteria for being capable of supporting life:

- Location: The exoplanet must be located within the habitable zone of its star, where conditions are right for liquid water to exist.
- Size and Composition: The exoplanet must be terrestrial (rocky) and have a size and mass within 0.5 to 2 times that of Earth.
- Atmosphere: The exoplanet must have an atmosphere containing elements essential for life as we understand it, such as oxygen, nitrogen, and carbon dioxide.
- Temperature: Surface temperatures on the exoplanet must be within a range that allows for the presence of liquid water.

The discovery must be confirmed by at least one of the following authoritative sources: NASA, ESA, or a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. The exoplanet must be a new discovery as of the date of this question's posting.

title: Will Israel hold a national election before 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Israel holds a national election before January 1, 2028. A national election is defined as an election for the Knesset, Israel's national legislature. The date of the election must be officially recognized and confirmed by the Central Elections Committee of Israel. In the event of multiple elections, the question resolves as Yes upon the first occurrence. If no national election is held before January 1, 2028, the question resolves as No.

title: Will Brazil hold a presidential election with a peaceful transfer of power by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Brazil holds a presidential election and the transfer of power to the newly elected president occurs without significant violence or large-scale civil unrest.

For the purposes of this question, a 'peaceful transfer of power' means that:
1. The outgoing president concedes defeat and publicly acknowledges the newly elected president.
2. The newly elected president is inaugurated and assumes office without any major incidents of violence or widespread civil unrest.
3. There are no military coups or attempts to overthrow the elected government.

Confirmation of the peaceful transfer of power must come from credible news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or Reuters. In case of conflicting reports, the consensus among these sources will be considered authoritative.

title: Will a new element be discovered and added to the periodic table by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new chemical element is discovered and officially added to the periodic table of elements.

The new element must be recognized by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) and assigned an official name and atomic number. The discovery must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or announced by IUPAC.

If multiple elements are discovered simultaneously, the resolution will be based on the first element officially recognized and added by IUPAC.

title: Will the United States achieve a 50% reduction in carbon emissions by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States achieves a 50% reduction in carbon emissions compared to the baseline year of 2005. The reduction must be confirmed by official data from the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) or another authoritative body such as the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). The reduction must be in total greenhouse gas emissions, measured in CO2-equivalent terms. In the absence of official data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary reductions due to exceptional circumstances (e.g., natural disasters, pandemics) do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will renewable energy sources account for more than 50% of global energy production by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, renewable energy sources (including solar, wind, hydro, geothermal, and biomass) account for more than 50% of global energy production.

The data for this determination must come from reputable sources such as the International Energy Agency (IEA), the United Nations (UN), or equivalent authoritative bodies. 

The calculation should be based on the total energy production from all sources, and renewable energy sources must collectively contribute more than half of this total. 

In the event of conflicting data, the consensus of the majority of these authoritative sources will be used to resolve the question.

Temporary spikes in renewable energy production due to unusual circumstances (e.g., temporary shutdowns of non-renewable energy plants) will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Conservative Party win the most seats in the United Kingdom general election in 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the Conservative Party wins the most seats in the United Kingdom general election held in 2028.

"Winning the most seats" means that the Conservative Party secures more seats than any other individual party in the House of Commons following the 2028 general election. 

The results must be confirmed by the official announcement from the UK Electoral Commission. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be sufficient. 

In case of a tie in the number of seats with another party, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new elementary particle be discovered in particle physics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new elementary particle is discovered and confirmed by the scientific community. The discovery must meet the following criteria:

- The particle must be a previously unknown elementary particle, not a composite particle or a known particle in a different state.
- The discovery must be announced by a major particle physics research organization such as CERN, Fermilab, or a similar institution.
- The discovery must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and corroborated by independent experiments or observations.
- The particle's properties (such as mass, charge, and spin) must be clearly identified and distinguishable from known particles.

In the event of a disputed discovery, the question will resolve as Yes only if the majority of the scientific community accepts the discovery by the resolution date. If no such consensus is reached, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will any German university be ranked in the top 10 for computer science by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, at least one German university is ranked in the top 10 for computer science in either the QS World University Rankings or the Times Higher Education World University Rankings. The ranking must be for the specific subject of computer science, not for overall university performance. If both rankings are published for the relevant year, the highest-ranked German university in either list will be considered. In the event of a tie (i.e., two or more German universities are ranked exactly 10th), this question will still resolve as Yes. If the rankings are not published for the relevant year, the most recent available rankings will be used.

title: Will NASA or another space agency successfully land a human on Mars by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, NASA or any other space agency successfully lands a human on the surface of Mars. A successful landing is defined as a human astronaut physically setting foot on Martian soil and safely transmitting this information back to Earth. The landing must be confirmed by an official announcement from the relevant space agency, and corroborated by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of conflicting information, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the majority of these sources. Temporary missions or landings that do not involve human astronauts setting foot on Mars do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) identify a new infectious disease before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) officially identifies a new infectious disease before January 1, 2028. The identification must meet the following criteria:

- The disease must be caused by a previously unknown pathogen (bacteria, virus, fungi, or other microorganisms).
- The identification must be confirmed through genetic or biochemical analysis.
- The CDC must publish an official report or announcement regarding the identification of the new infectious disease.

The question resolves as No if no such identification is made by the CDC before the resolution date, or if the identified disease is not caused by a previously unknown pathogen.

title: Will the number of operational industrial robots in Italy exceed 100,000 by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the number of operational industrial robots in Italy exceeds 100,000.

An "operational industrial robot" is defined according to the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) as an automatically controlled, reprogrammable, multipurpose manipulator programmable in three or more axes, which can be either fixed in place or mobile for use in industrial automation applications.

The count of operational industrial robots will be based on official statistics from the International Federation of Robotics (IFR) or, in the absence of IFR data, from a credible government or industry report. If conflicting reports exist, the majority consensus among these sources will determine the resolution.

Temporary installations or robots not used for industrial purposes will not be counted.

In the event of data unavailability, the question will be resolved based on the best available information from reputable sources.

title: Will Sweden elect a new prime minister by the end of 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Sweden elects a new prime minister by December 31, 2028. A new prime minister is defined as an individual who has not previously held the office of prime minister of Sweden. The election must be officially confirmed by the Swedish Election Authority or reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no new prime minister is elected by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will any country elect a leader with a background in immunology by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any country elects a leader (head of state or head of government) who has a formal background in immunology. 

A 'formal background in immunology' is defined as having at least a Master's degree or equivalent in immunology or a closely related field (e.g., microbiology, virology, or infectious diseases) from an accredited institution. 

The election must be officially recognized by the country's electoral authority. In the case of disputed elections, the resolution will depend on the official outcome recognized by international bodies such as the United Nations or the European Union. 

The leader must assume office to count towards this question's resolution. Interim or acting leaders do not count unless they are formally elected to the position during the specified period. 

The resolution will be based on credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will South Korea win a Nobel Prize in a natural science category by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a South Korean citizen or a team of researchers primarily affiliated with a South Korean institution is awarded a Nobel Prize in one of the natural science categories (Physics, Chemistry, or Physiology or Medicine).

The award must be officially recognized by the Nobel Assembly and announced on the official Nobel Prize website (nobelprize.org). In the event of a shared prize, at least one of the recipients must meet the criteria mentioned above for the question to resolve as Yes.

If no such award is given by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system be used to assist the US House of Representatives in legislative processes by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system is officially used to assist the US House of Representatives in any legislative process. 

The AI system must be capable of analyzing, drafting, or providing recommendations on legislative matters. 

The deployment of such a system must be confirmed by an official announcement from the US House of Representatives or another authoritative government body. 

In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The AI system must be operational and used in a formal capacity, not in a trial or experimental phase. 

Temporary or limited use of AI for specific events or tasks does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will autonomous robotic systems be deployed in military operations by major powers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any of the following major powers: the United States, China, Russia, the United Kingdom, or France, officially deploy autonomous robotic systems in military operations. 

"Autonomous robotic systems" are defined as systems capable of performing tasks without human intervention, including but not limited to surveillance, reconnaissance, logistics, and combat operations. 

The deployment must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The systems must be operational and not in a trial or testing phase. Deployment in non-combat roles (e.g., logistics or surveillance) counts towards this question's resolution. Temporary deployments for specific events do not count.

title: Will Italy elect a new prime minister before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a new individual is inaugurated as the Prime Minister of Italy before January 1, 2028. 
The new Prime Minister must be officially sworn in and recognized by the Italian government. 
Confirmation from reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, or Washington Post will be used to verify the inauguration. 
In the event of a temporary or acting Prime Minister, the question will resolve as Yes only if the individual is officially designated as the permanent Prime Minister.

title: Will Italy hold a national referendum on constitutional changes before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Italy holds a national referendum specifically aimed at making changes to its constitution. 

A national referendum is defined as a vote in which all eligible citizens of Italy are invited to participate. 

The referendum must be officially announced by the Italian government and covered by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). 

The question resolves as Yes regardless of the outcome of the referendum, as long as the vote is held. If no such referendum takes place by the specified date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will NASA discover definitive evidence of life on another planet by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, NASA announces and the scientific community recognizes evidence of life on another planet that meets the following criteria:

- Microbial Life: Discovery of extraterrestrial-origin microbial life through genetic or biochemical analysis.
- Fossilized Life: Unambiguous identification of extraterrestrial-origin fossils indicating past life.
- Biochemical Markers: Detection of biochemical markers uniquely associated with extraterrestrial biological processes.
- Atmospheric or Soil Analysis: Incontrovertible evidence of biological activity from atmospheric or soil analysis.

This question resolves as YES upon official recognition of the discovery by NASA and a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or major conference. Otherwise, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will Taiwan hold national elections by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Taiwan holds national elections for its President and Legislative Yuan. The elections must be officially recognized and validated by Taiwan's Central Election Commission. In the event of any disputes or delays, the resolution will be based on the final decision of Taiwan's Central Election Commission or the highest judicial authority in Taiwan. If no national elections are held by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system win a Nobel Prize in Physics by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system is awarded a Nobel Prize in Physics. The AI system must be explicitly named as the recipient or co-recipient of the prize in the official Nobel Prize announcement. The question will resolve as No if no AI system is named as a recipient or co-recipient by the resolution date. The Nobel Prize announcement must come from the official Nobel Prize organization (NobelPrize.org) and be widely reported by reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, and Washington Post. In the event of any ambiguity, the official Nobel Prize announcement will be the final authority.

title: Will the impact of COVID-19 lead to significant changes in election procedures in any major country by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any major country (defined as a member of the G20) implements significant changes to its election procedures directly attributed to the impact of COVID-19. Significant changes include:

- Introduction of universal mail-in voting.
- Implementation of nationwide online voting.
- Major changes to in-person voting procedures, such as extended voting periods or extensive use of new technologies to ensure social distancing and hygiene.

The changes must be confirmed by official government documentation or announcements. In the absence of official documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary changes for a single election cycle do not count towards this question's resolution. The changes must be intended for long-term implementation.

title: Will the US House of Representatives see a shift in majority control before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the majority control of the US House of Representatives shifts from one political party to another. 

"Majority control" is defined as the political party that holds more than half of the total seats in the House of Representatives. 

The shift in majority control must be officially recognized through the certification of election results by the Clerk of the House of Representatives or through an official announcement by the Speaker of the House. 

In the event of a tie or coalition, the question will resolve as Yes if the majority coalition includes a different political party as the leading party compared to the previous majority control. 

If no such shift occurs before the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US House of Representatives have a female Speaker of the House by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a female member of the US House of Representatives is officially elected and sworn in as the Speaker of the House.

The election and swearing-in must be confirmed by an official announcement from the US House of Representatives or documented in the Congressional Record. 
In the absence of such documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question resolves as No if no female member is elected and sworn in by the resolution date.

title: Will Virginia implement a new voting technology in state elections by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Virginia officially implements a new voting technology in state elections. 'New voting technology' refers to any system or device that is substantially different from those used in the previous election cycle and aims to improve voting processes, security, or accessibility. The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Virginia Department of Elections or other authorized state body. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., The Washington Post, The New York Times, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian) are sufficient. The technology must be operational and used in at least one state election. Pilot programs or trials do not count unless they are used in an official state election.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used to optimize energy consumption in major cities by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, artificial intelligence (AI) systems are used to optimize energy consumption in at least three major cities globally. A "major city" is defined as a metropolitan area with a population exceeding 1 million inhabitants. "Optimize energy consumption" means that AI systems are actively managing and improving the efficiency of energy use across the city's infrastructure, including but not limited to, electricity grids, transportation systems, and public buildings. The deployment of such AI systems must be confirmed by official government announcements or documentation from city administrations. In the absence of official announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The AI systems must be operational and not merely in a pilot or testing phase. Temporary implementations for specific events do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a candidate from Virginia win a major party nomination in the 2028 US presidential election?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a candidate from Virginia wins the nomination for the presidential election from either the Democratic Party or the Republican Party.

A "candidate from Virginia" is defined as an individual who meets at least one of the following criteria:
- Was born in Virginia.
- Has lived in Virginia for at least 10 consecutive years.
- Has held a significant political office in Virginia (e.g., Governor, Senator, or Representative).

The nomination must be officially recognized by the respective party's national convention. Verification will be based on announcements from the Democratic National Committee (DNC) or the Republican National Committee (RNC), or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will there be a significant biological threat that impacts international relations by 2028?
Will Canada become a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Canada is officially recognized as a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC).

"Permanent member" refers to a member nation that has been granted permanent status and the associated veto power within the UNSC, similar to the current permanent members (China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom, and the United States).

The official recognition must come from an authoritative source such as an official United Nations announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary or rotating membership does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant geopolitical conflict involving the Amazon rainforest by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a significant geopolitical conflict involving the Amazon rainforest occurs. 

A 'significant geopolitical conflict' is defined as one that meets any of the following criteria:
- Involves military action or armed conflict between two or more countries.
- Results in the imposition of economic sanctions by one country or a coalition of countries against another country over issues directly related to the Amazon rainforest.
- Leads to a formal dispute brought before an international body such as the United Nations or the International Court of Justice, explicitly concerning the Amazon rainforest.

To resolve as Yes, the conflict must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

If no such conflict is reported by the resolution date, this question resolves as No.

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI that can consistently outperform human experts in medical diagnosis by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI developed by DeepMind consistently outperforms human experts in medical diagnosis. 

The criteria for 'consistently outperform' are:
1. The AI achieves a diagnostic accuracy rate at least 5% higher than the average accuracy rate of human experts in the same field, across multiple studies.
2. The AI's performance is validated through peer-reviewed publications or presentations at major medical conferences.
3. The AI is tested across a diverse set of medical conditions and patient demographics.

Human experts are defined as board-certified physicians with at least 5 years of clinical experience in the relevant field. 

The studies must be conducted by independent research institutions or hospitals and must be published in reputable medical journals (e.g., The Lancet, JAMA, NEJM). In the event of conflicting results, the consensus of the majority of the studies will be considered. Temporary or trial deployments do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the employment rate for software developers increase according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the employment rate for software developers, as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), shows an increase compared to the rate reported for the year 2023.

The employment rate is defined as the percentage of software developers employed out of the total number of software developers in the labor force. The BLS's annual report on employment statistics will be the authoritative source for this information.

In the event that the BLS changes its reporting methodology or classification of software developers, the most comparable data available will be used to determine the outcome.

If the BLS ceases to publish employment statistics for software developers, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will AI discover a new chemical element or compound by 2028?
body:
