This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, an artificial intelligence (AI) system is credited with the discovery of a new chemical element or compound that meets the following criteria:

- The discovery must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- The AI system must be acknowledged as the primary discoverer in the publication, either through direct authorship or explicit recognition by the human authors.
- The new element must be recognized by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) if it is an element, or the new compound must be recognized by a relevant authoritative body in the field of chemistry.

The discovery must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources, such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or similar. In case of simultaneous discoveries, the resolution will be based on the earliest publication date.

title: Will a new political party win a majority in any national election by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a political party that did not exist prior to January 1, 2024, wins a majority of seats in the national legislature or equivalent governing body in any country.

A "majority" is defined as more than 50% of the available seats. The election must be recognized as free and fair by international observers, such as the United Nations or the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE).

Official election results must be reported by reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In case of disputes or recounts, the final certified results will be used for resolution.

If no election meets these criteria by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US establish a new branch of the military focused on aerospace engineering by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States establishes a new branch of the military specifically focused on aerospace engineering. The establishment must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The branch must be distinct from existing branches and have a clear mandate focused on aerospace engineering. Temporary task forces or rebranding of existing units do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Virginia elect a Democratic governor in the 2028 election?

The election results must be confirmed by the Virginia Department of Elections. In the event of a dispute or recount, the question will resolve based on the final certified result.

If the election is annulled or postponed beyond December 31, 2028, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US Senate pass a bill specifically regulating the use of CRISPR technology in humans by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States Senate passes a bill that specifically regulates the use of CRISPR technology in humans. 

To qualify, the bill must address the use of CRISPR for human genetic modification, including but not limited to gene editing for therapeutic, enhancement, or reproductive purposes. The regulation must be explicitly stated in the text of the bill. 

Confirmation of the bill's passage must come from an official U.S. government source, such as the Congressional Record or an official announcement from the Senate. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Associated Press) are sufficient. 

If the bill is vetoed by the President or fails to pass in the House of Representatives, it will still count as a Yes for this question as long as it has passed in the Senate. 

If no such bill is passed by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will Brazil achieve a 10% increase in its renewable energy production by December 31, 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Brazil's renewable energy production increases by at least 10% compared to its production as of January 1, 2024. The increase must be verified by official data from Brazil's Ministry of Mines and Energy or equivalent authoritative body. Renewable energy includes sources such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, biomass, and geothermal. Reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) may be used as supplementary evidence but not as primary verification. In the event of conflicting data, the most recent official data will be used for resolution.

title: Will a new genetically modified crop be approved for commercial use in the US by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new genetically modified crop is approved for commercial use in the United States.

A "new genetically modified crop" is defined as a crop that has not been previously approved for commercial use in the US prior to the start of this question's forecasting period.

"Approved for commercial use" means that the crop has received all necessary regulatory approvals from relevant US authorities, including but not limited to the US Department of Agriculture (USDA), the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), and the Food and Drug Administration (FDA).

The approval must be confirmed through official announcements or documentation from these regulatory bodies. In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian) are sufficient.

The crop must be intended for widespread commercial cultivation and not merely for experimental or restricted use.

title: Will Canada experience a measurable increase in average annual temperature by at least 1°C compared to the 1991-2020 baseline before December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2028, the average annual temperature in Canada increases by at least 1°C compared to the 1991-2020 baseline.

The determination will be based on data from authoritative sources such as Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC), the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), or the World Meteorological Organization (WMO).

The average annual temperature will be calculated as the mean of the daily average temperatures over the entire year.

In the event of discrepancies between sources, the majority consensus among these organizations will be used for resolution.

If the data is not available from these sources, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new vaccine for a major infectious disease be approved for use in Australia before January 1, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a new vaccine for a major infectious disease is approved for use in Australia before January 1, 2028.

A "major infectious disease" is defined as a disease that causes significant morbidity and/or mortality on a global or national scale, such as COVID-19, influenza, malaria, tuberculosis, or HIV/AIDS.

The vaccine must receive official approval from the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) of Australia.

The approval must be publicly announced by the TGA or reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

This question resolves as No if no such vaccine is approved by the specified date.

title: Will Australia experience a measurable increase in average annual temperature by at least 1°C compared to the 1991-2020 baseline before December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2028, the average annual temperature in Australia is measured to be at least 1°C higher than the 1991-2020 baseline.

The temperature data must be sourced from the Australian Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) or an equivalent authoritative body, such as the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) or the World Meteorological Organization (WMO).

The average annual temperature is defined as the mean of daily temperatures recorded over the entire year. The comparison baseline (1991-2020) refers to the average annual temperatures recorded during those years.

In the event of conflicting data, the data from BOM will take precedence. If BOM data is unavailable, data from NOAA or WMO will be used.

Temporary temperature spikes due to short-term phenomena (e.g., El Niño) do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new chemical element be discovered in space by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new chemical element is discovered in space. The discovery must meet the following criteria:

- The element must be previously unknown to science and not listed on the periodic table as of January 1, 2024.
- The discovery must be confirmed through spectroscopic analysis or other definitive scientific methods.
- The discovery must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and recognized by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC).
- The element must be detected in a space environment, such as in stars, interstellar medium, or other celestial bodies.

In the event of simultaneous discoveries, the resolution will be based on the date of the first peer-reviewed publication. If the discovery is disputed or not recognized by IUPAC, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a space mission be powered by a nuclear energy source before January 1, 2028?

This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a space mission is officially launched and powered by a nuclear energy source. The nuclear energy source must be used for propulsion or as a primary power source for the mission's operations.

The launch must be confirmed by an official announcement from a recognized space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO) or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

The mission must have successfully reached space, defined as beyond the Kármán line (100 kilometers above sea level).

title: Will an AI system be developed that can predict the exchange rate of USD to INR with an accuracy of at least 95% for a 30-day period by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system is developed that can predict the exchange rate of USD to INR with an accuracy of at least 95% for a continuous 30-day period.

The AI system must meet the following criteria:
- The prediction accuracy is calculated as the percentage of days within the 30-day period where the predicted exchange rate is within 1% of the actual exchange rate.
- The accuracy measurement must be verified by at least two independent financial institutions or academic bodies.
- The AI system must be publicly documented and accessible for verification purposes. Proprietary systems without public documentation do not qualify.

In the event of multiple AI systems achieving this accuracy, the first one to be verified by the independent bodies will be considered for resolution. The verification must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The system must be capable of real-time traffic monitoring, predictive analytics for traffic flow, and automated traffic control measures. Temporary or pilot implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will an AI system be developed that can pass the Turing Test with over 90% success rate by December 31, 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system is publicly demonstrated to pass the Turing Test with a success rate of over 90%. The Turing Test is defined as a test where human judges engage in natural language conversations with both an AI and a human without knowing which is which. The AI system must convince over 90% of the judges that it is the human. The demonstration must be conducted under controlled conditions and verified by at least two reputable organizations in the field of artificial intelligence, such as the Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) or the European Association for Artificial Intelligence (EurAI). In the absence of verification by these organizations, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

title: Will the United Kingdom pass a law regulating artificial intelligence in information technology by December 31, 2028?

The law must address at least one of the following areas:

- Ethical guidelines for AI development and deployment.
- Accountability and liability for AI-driven decisions.
- Standards for AI transparency and explainability.
- Measures to prevent biases and discrimination in AI algorithms.

The enactment must be confirmed by an official publication in the UK government's legislation database or an announcement by a relevant government authority. In the absence of such confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question resolves as No if no such law is enacted by the specified date.

title: Will the value of the US dollar against the Euro increase by at least 10% by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the exchange rate of the US dollar (USD) against the Euro (EUR) increases by at least 10% compared to its value on January 1, 2028.

The exchange rate will be determined using the daily closing rates provided by the European Central Bank (ECB). The percentage increase will be calculated using the formula: 

Percentage Increase = [(Closing Rate on December 31, 2028 - Closing Rate on January 1, 2028) / Closing Rate on January 1, 2028] * 100

If the ECB does not publish the exchange rate on the specified dates, the closing rate from the next available date will be used. If the ECB ceases to publish exchange rates or if there are significant market disruptions, rates from a reputable financial data provider such as Bloomberg or Reuters will be used as a fallback.

title: Will Italy's space agency, ASI, successfully land a spacecraft on the Moon before January 1, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Italy's space agency (ASI) successfully lands a spacecraft on the Moon.

A successful landing is defined as:
- The spacecraft makes contact with the lunar surface in a controlled manner.
- The spacecraft is able to transmit data back to Earth after landing.

The landing must be confirmed by an official announcement from ASI or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

If the landing is part of an international collaboration, ASI must be officially recognized as a leading partner in the mission.

title: Will a new international law specifically addressing particle physics research be enacted before January 1, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a new international law specifically addressing particle physics research is enacted. 

The law must be formally adopted by an international organization or agreement involving multiple countries, such as the United Nations, European Union, or similar entities. 

The law must explicitly mention particle physics research and outline regulations, guidelines, or policies directly related to this field. 

Confirmation of the law's enactment must come from official documentation or announcements from the relevant international body or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

title: Will Brazil pass a federal law mandating engineering ethics courses in all engineering degree programs by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Brazil passes a federal law that mandates the inclusion of engineering ethics courses in all engineering degree programs across the country.

The law must explicitly require that engineering ethics be a compulsory part of the curriculum for all engineering degree programs offered by accredited institutions in Brazil.

Confirmation of the law's passage must come from an official publication in the Diário Oficial da União (Official Gazette of the Union) or an official announcement by the Brazilian government. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Folha de S.Paulo, O Globo, Estadão) are sufficient.

The question will resolve as No if no such law is passed by the specified date.

body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a new international law specifically addressing engineering standards and practices is officially enacted. 

For the purposes of this question, 'international law' is defined as a legally binding agreement or treaty between two or more countries, ratified by the respective governing bodies of those countries. 

The law must explicitly pertain to engineering standards and practices, and not be a part of a broader agreement with only tangential relevance to engineering. 

The enactment of such a law must be confirmed by official documentation from the United Nations, the European Union, or another recognized international governing body, or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

- An "immunology-related illness" includes any disease or condition that affects the immune system, as confirmed by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) or the California Department of Public Health (CDPH).
- An "outbreak" is defined as the occurrence of cases of an illness in a community or region, clearly in excess of normal expectancy, as confirmed by the CDC or CDPH.
- The count of affected individuals must be confirmed by the CDC or CDPH through diagnostic testing or epidemiological investigation.

In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will SpaceX successfully launch and land a Starship rocket on the moon before December 31, 2028?

This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2028, SpaceX successfully launches and lands a Starship rocket on the moon. 

"Successfully launches" means that the rocket reaches lunar orbit or a direct trajectory to the moon after liftoff from Earth. 

"Successfully lands" means that the rocket touches down on the lunar surface in a controlled manner, remaining intact and capable of performing its intended functions. 

Confirmation of the launch and landing must come from an official SpaceX announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice. 

The landing must be part of a mission explicitly intended to land on the moon; accidental or unintended landings do not count towards this question's resolution.

AI must be defined within the legislation as an entity capable of holding legal rights and responsibilities, similar to a corporation or individual. 
The passing of such legislation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. 
In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 
This question resolves as NO if no such legislation is passed and enacted by the resolution date.

The peer-reviewed paper must be published in a reputable academic journal in the fields of artificial intelligence, cognitive science, or philosophy. Confirmation of the paper's publication must come from the journal's official website or an announcement by the authors affiliated with recognized academic institutions. In the event of multiple papers, the first paper to meet these criteria will be considered.

body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a machine learning model achieves an accuracy of at least 95% on the ImageNet dataset.

The accuracy must be reported in a peer-reviewed paper or at a major AI conference (such as NeurIPS, ICML, or CVPR) and must be verified by independent experts in the field.

The ImageNet dataset refers to the standard benchmark dataset used in the ImageNet Large Scale Visual Recognition Challenge (ILSVRC) as of 2024.

In case of any changes or updates to the dataset, the resolution will be based on the latest version of the ImageNet dataset used in the ILSVRC.

The accuracy must be achieved without any form of data augmentation that is not part of the official training process for the ImageNet competition.

In the event of multiple models claiming this achievement, the first model to be officially recognized and verified will be considered for resolution.

The primary source for this data will be the International Data Corporation (IDC) Worldwide Black Book or an equivalent reputable market research firm such as Gartner, Forrester, or Statista. 

If IDC data is unavailable, data from at least two of the other mentioned sources will be used. If there is a discrepancy between sources, the majority consensus will be used.

The final determination will be based on data published by these sources by March 31, 2029.

- The system must simulate all aspects of an NBA game, including player movements, ball physics, and game rules. 
- The simulation must run at real-time speed, meaning the virtual game progresses at the same rate as a real game. 
- The system must be able to simulate a full 48-minute game without interruption. 
- The simulation's accuracy must be verified by at least three reputable sources, such as major tech publications (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, MIT Technology Review) or sports analysis organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated).
- The system must be publicly demonstrated or documented, with evidence available for independent verification.

If no such system is developed by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US dollar experience a depreciation of at least 10% against the Euro by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the US dollar (USD) experiences a depreciation of at least 10% against the Euro (EUR) compared to its value on January 1, 2028.

The depreciation will be measured using the exchange rate published by the European Central Bank (ECB) on these dates. The percentage change will be calculated as: ((Exchange Rate on December 31, 2028 - Exchange Rate on January 1, 2028) / Exchange Rate on January 1, 2028) * 100.

If the ECB does not publish exchange rates on the specified dates, the most recent available rates before these dates will be used. If the ECB ceases to publish exchange rates, rates from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) will be used as a fallback.

This question resolves as NO if the depreciation is less than 10% or if the USD appreciates against the EUR.

body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations officially reports that global CO2 emissions have decreased by at least 5% compared to 2022 levels. The official report must come from a reputable UN body such as the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) or the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC). The reduction must be based on comprehensive data analysis and peer-reviewed methodologies. In the absence of an official UN report, credible reports from at least three major scientific organizations or peer-reviewed journals confirming the reduction will be considered sufficient. Temporary reductions due to extraordinary events (e.g., global pandemics, economic recessions) will not count towards this question's resolution unless explicitly stated in the report.

title: Will a new material with superconductivity properties be discovered and verified by a reputable scientific journal before December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2028, a new material with superconductivity properties is discovered and verified by a reputable scientific journal. 

The material must exhibit superconductivity, defined as zero electrical resistance and the expulsion of magnetic fields (Meissner effect), at any temperature. The discovery must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and recognized by the scientific community. 

Verification requires that the material's superconducting properties are independently replicated by at least two other research groups. 

In the event of conflicting reports, the question will be resolved based on the consensus of the scientific community as of the resolution date.

title: Will a member of the US House of Representatives make a cameo appearance in a major motion picture before December 31, 2028?
body:
This question resolves as Yes if, before December 31, 2028, a sitting member of the US House of Representatives makes a cameo appearance in a major motion picture. 

A "cameo appearance" is defined as a brief appearance or voice-only role by a well-known person, typically playing themselves. 

A "major motion picture" is defined as a feature-length film that is widely released in theaters or on a major streaming platform (e.g., Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney+, HBO Max). 

The cameo appearance must be confirmed by the film's official credits, or by reputable news sources such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, or Variety. 

If the cameo is cut from the final release but is included in official promotional material or extended editions, it will still count towards resolving this question as Yes.

title: Will a chemistry-themed movie win an Academy Award for Best Picture before January 1, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a chemistry-themed movie wins the Academy Award for Best Picture before January 1, 2028.

A "chemistry-themed movie" is defined as a film where the primary plot or a significant subplot revolves around chemistry, chemists, or chemical phenomena. The film's connection to chemistry must be substantial and evident.

The win must be officially recognized by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS) during their annual awards ceremony. In the event of a tie or any other unforeseen circumstances, the resolution will be based on the official decision made by AMPAS.

If no chemistry-themed movie wins Best Picture by the specified date, this question resolves as No.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a bill implementing machine learning for federal administrative processes by December 31, 2028?
body: This question resolves positively if the US House of Representatives passes a bill that mandates the use of machine learning technologies in federal administrative processes before the specified date. The resolution will be based on official records from the US Congress.

title: Will a machine learning algorithm predict the outcome of a US House of Representatives election with at least 90% accuracy by November 7, 2028?
body: This question resolves positively if a machine learning algorithm correctly predicts at least 90% of the results of the US House of Representatives elections held on November 7, 2028. The resolution will be based on the publicly available prediction results and the official election outcomes.

title: Will the United Kingdom increase its renewable energy capacity by at least 20% by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom's renewable energy capacity (measured in megawatts) has increased by at least 20% compared to its capacity as of January 1, 2024. 

The increase must be confirmed by official statistics from the UK Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy (BEIS) or a reputable international energy agency such as the International Energy Agency (IEA). 

In the absence of official statistics, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The term "renewable energy" includes energy generated from sources such as wind, solar, hydroelectric, and geothermal. It does not include nuclear energy or fossil fuels, even if they are used in conjunction with carbon capture and storage technologies.

title: Will the United Kingdom implement a nationwide AI-driven energy management system by December 31, 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom has officially implemented a nationwide AI-driven energy management system. The system must use artificial intelligence to optimize energy distribution, consumption, or production on a national scale. The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational and not in a trial phase. Partial implementations limited to specific regions or sectors do not count towards this question's resolution. Temporary implementations for specific events also do not count.

title: Will an AI model accurately predict chemical reactions with over 95% accuracy by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI model is demonstrated to predict chemical reactions with an accuracy rate exceeding 95%. The following conditions must be met:

- The AI model must be able to predict reaction outcomes across a broad range of chemical reactions, not limited to a specific subset.
- The accuracy rate of over 95% must be validated through peer-reviewed publications or presentations at major scientific conferences.
- Independent verification by at least two recognized experts in the field of computational chemistry or chemical engineering is required.
- The AI model’s predictions must be reproducible by other researchers using the same methodology and data set.

In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the scientific community as reflected in peer-reviewed literature.

The announcement must be reported by NASA's official channels or a reputable news source.

title: Will Australia pass a federal law mandating at least 50% of energy to come from renewable sources by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Australian federal government passes a law mandating that at least 50% of the country's energy must come from renewable sources. 

"Renewable sources" include solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass energy. 

The law must be enacted and come into effect by the resolution date. 

Confirmation of the law's passage must come from an official government announcement or documentation. 

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The question resolves as No if no such law is passed and enacted by the resolution date.

title: Will California enact a state law banning the sale of new gasoline-powered vehicles by January 1, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the state of California enacts a law that explicitly bans the sale of new gasoline-powered vehicles within its jurisdiction, effective on or before January 1, 2028.

The law must be signed by the Governor of California and published in the official California Legislative Information website or another official government publication. 

The ban must apply to the sale of new gasoline-powered vehicles and not just restrict their use or provide incentives for electric vehicles. 

If the law is challenged in court, the question will still resolve as Yes as long as the law is enacted and signed by the Governor by the resolution date, regardless of any pending legal challenges or injunctions. 

In the absence of official publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the enactment of the law are sufficient.

title: Will Australia introduce a national law requiring all new residential buildings to include solar panels by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Australia enacts national legislation mandating that all new residential buildings must be equipped with solar panels. The law must apply to all new residential constructions without exception, though it may include provisions for certain types of buildings or regions.

The enactment of the law must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation, such as publication in the Government Gazette or equivalent. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The resolution will not consider state or local laws; it must be a national law. Temporary regulations, pilot programs, or incentives do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will an artificial intelligence system pass a formally administered Turing Test, as judged by a panel of at least 5 experts in the field, before January 1, 2028?
body:
This question resolves as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, an artificial intelligence system passes a Turing Test administered under the following conditions:

- The Turing Test must be formally administered, meaning it is organized and conducted by a recognized institution or organization in the field of artificial intelligence.
- The panel judging the test must consist of at least 5 experts in artificial intelligence or related fields.
- The AI system must be able to engage in natural language conversation with human judges and convince at least 30% of them that it is human.
- The test must be conducted in a controlled environment where the judges are unaware of which participants are human and which are AI.
- The results of the test must be published in a peer-reviewed journal or presented at a major AI conference, and the AI's success must be acknowledged by a consensus of the scientific community.

In case of partial success or ambiguous results, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Microsoft release an AI-driven product that achieves at least 1 million active users within 6 months of launch before December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2028, Microsoft releases an AI-driven product that achieves at least 1 million active users within 6 months of its launch date.

The product must be branded as a Microsoft product and be available to the general public. The term 'active users' is defined as users who interact with the product at least once within a 30-day period. The user count must be verified by credible sources, such as an official Microsoft announcement, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of multiple product releases, the first product to meet the criteria will be considered. If no product achieves 1 million active users within 6 months of launch by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Japan enact a new national law specifically addressing cybersecurity standards before January 1, 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Japan enacts a new national law specifically addressing cybersecurity standards. The law must be officially passed by the National Diet of Japan and signed by the Prime Minister or become law through other legislative means. The new law must specifically address cybersecurity standards, which include but are not limited to data protection, network security, and cyber incident response. Amendments to existing laws do not count unless they introduce substantial new provisions specifically focused on cybersecurity standards. The enactment must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The player must win the singles title in each of these tournaments within the same calendar year. Verification of the wins must be confirmed by official tournament records and announcements from the respective Grand Slam organizations (Tennis Australia, Fédération Française de Tennis, The All England Lawn Tennis Club, and the United States Tennis Association). In case of any tournament cancellations or other exceptional circumstances, the question will be resolved based on the official records and announcements from these organizations.

title: Will a new record for the fastest serve in tennis be set before January 1, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a new record for the fastest serve in tennis is officially recognized by the ATP (Association of Tennis Professionals) or WTA (Women's Tennis Association) before January 1, 2028. 

The serve must be recorded during an official ATP or WTA match, and the speed must be measured and verified by the official radar gun or an equivalent device approved by the ATP or WTA. 

The new record must be publicly announced and documented on the official ATP or WTA website, or reported by at least three major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, BBC Sport, Reuters, Associated Press). 

In the event of a tie (i.e., multiple serves recorded at the same speed), the question will resolve as Yes if the tied speed surpasses the previous record.

title: Will Australia pass a federal law addressing climate change mitigation strategies by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Australia passes a federal law specifically aimed at addressing climate change mitigation strategies. The law must include provisions for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, promoting renewable energy, or enhancing carbon sequestration.

The passage of the law must be confirmed by an official announcement in the Australian Parliament or government gazette. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The law must be enacted and not merely proposed or under discussion. Amendments to existing laws that include significant new climate change mitigation strategies will also count towards this question's resolution. If the law is challenged in court, the question will still resolve as Yes if the law is in effect as of the resolution date.

title: Will Norway enact a new law specifically addressing engineering standards before January 1, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Norway enacts a new law that specifically addresses engineering standards.

The law must be officially passed by the Norwegian Parliament (Storting) and signed into law by the King of Norway. The law must explicitly mention engineering standards in its title or main text.

The emissions data must be for the entire calendar year of 2028. If multiple sources provide conflicting data, the majority consensus among the sources will be used to determine the outcome.

Quantum supremacy is defined as the ability of a quantum computer to perform a calculation that is infeasible for any classical computer to complete within a reasonable timeframe.

The demonstration must be publicly announced and documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference. Additionally, the claim must be verified by independent experts in the field of quantum computing.

In the event of multiple claims, the resolution will be based on the earliest verified demonstration. If no such demonstration occurs by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a quantum computer achieve a computational speed 1000 times faster than the fastest classical supercomputer by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a quantum computer achieves a computational speed 1000 times faster than the fastest classical supercomputer as measured by a recognized benchmark.

The criteria for resolution are:

1. Benchmark: The computational speed must be measured using a widely accepted and recognized benchmark (e.g., LINPACK, Qubit count, Quantum Volume).
2. Verification: The achievement must be verified by a reputable independent organization or consortium specializing in quantum computing or supercomputing (e.g., TOP500, IBM, Google, or a major academic institution).
3. Public Announcement: The achievement must be publicly announced and documented in a reputable source, such as a peer-reviewed journal, a major conference, or credible media outlets (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
4. Edge Cases: In the event of multiple claims, the first publicly documented and independently verified instance will be considered.
5. Fall-back Scenario: If no such achievement is verified by December 31, 2028, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will any country announce the successful genetic modification of a human embryo that is viable and healthy, confirmed by peer-reviewed studies, before January 1, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, any country announces the successful genetic modification of a human embryo that is both viable and healthy. The following criteria must be met:

1. Viability: The embryo must develop into a fetus and be carried to term, resulting in a live birth.
2. Health: The resulting child must be free from genetic disorders or other health issues directly attributable to the genetic modification.

Confirmation must come from peer-reviewed studies published in reputable scientific journals. The announcement must be made by an official government body or a recognized scientific institution. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In case of multiple announcements, the first one to meet all criteria will be considered for resolution. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

A "new strain" is defined as a variant of a microorganism (virus, bacterium, fungus, or protozoan) that has not been previously identified or recognized by the WHO. The declaration must be publicly available on the WHO's official website or announced through an official WHO press release. The pandemic declaration must meet the criteria set by the WHO for a pandemic, which generally includes widespread human infection, sustained human-to-human transmission, and global spread. If the WHO retracts the pandemic declaration before January 1, 2028, the question will resolve as No. In the absence of an official WHO declaration, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US dollar's average annual exchange rate against the Euro decrease by at least 5% in 2028 compared to 2027?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the average annual exchange rate of the US dollar (USD) against the Euro (EUR) decreases by at least 5% in 2028 compared to 2027.

The average annual exchange rate for each year will be calculated using the daily exchange rates published by the Federal Reserve (https://www.federalreserve.gov/releases/h10/).

The percentage decrease will be calculated using the formula: 

((Average Exchange Rate in 2027 - Average Exchange Rate in 2028) / Average Exchange Rate in 2027) * 100.

If the result is greater than or equal to 5%, the question will resolve as Yes. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

In the event that the Federal Reserve does not publish the daily exchange rates for any part of 2027 or 2028, the question will be resolved using the daily exchange rates published by the European Central Bank (ECB).

title: Will the US Congress pass at least five new laws by December 31, 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States Congress passes at least five new laws. A law is considered 'passed' when it has been approved by both the House of Representatives and the Senate, and then signed into law by the President. The resolution will be based on official records from congress.gov or another authoritative source confirming the passage of the laws. If there is a government shutdown or other extraordinary circumstances that prevent the passage of new laws, those laws will not count towards the resolution of this question unless they are passed by the specified date.

title: Will Japan enact a new law to regulate autonomous vehicles before December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2028, Japan enacts a new law that specifically regulates the operation, safety, and deployment of autonomous vehicles. The law must be passed by the National Diet of Japan and officially published in the country's legal gazette or official government website. The law must include provisions that address the following aspects:

- Operational guidelines for autonomous vehicles on public roads.
- Safety standards and requirements for autonomous vehicle manufacturers and operators.
- Liability and insurance regulations concerning autonomous vehicle accidents.
- Any additional regulatory frameworks specific to autonomous vehicles.

The passage of the law must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., NHK, The Japan Times, Reuters, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such law is enacted by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Sweden enact a national policy specifically regulating the use of artificial intelligence before January 1, 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Sweden enacts a national policy specifically regulating the use of artificial intelligence (AI). The policy must be a formal legislative act, regulation, or government directive that explicitly addresses AI regulation. General technology or data protection laws that do not specifically mention AI will not count. The enactment must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

title: Will an AI system be implemented in Sweden to manage at least 50% of the national energy grid by January 1, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, an AI system is officially implemented in Sweden to manage at least 50% of the national energy grid. The AI system must be capable of making real-time decisions for energy distribution and management.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation from a recognized Swedish energy authority. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational and not in a trial phase.

In the event of partial deployment, the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for nationwide expansion and is managing at least 50% of the national energy grid. Temporary deployments for specific events or limited trials do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the James Webb Space Telescope discover signs of extraterrestrial biotechnology on any exoplanet before January 1, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) discovers signs of extraterrestrial biotechnology on any exoplanet. Signs of extraterrestrial biotechnology are defined as follows:

- Detection of chemical compounds in the atmosphere of an exoplanet that are widely recognized as indicators of biological technology, such as industrial pollutants or artificial light.
- Identification of structures or patterns on the surface of an exoplanet that are widely recognized as indicators of advanced technological activity.

The discovery must be confirmed by an official announcement from NASA or the European Space Agency (ESA) and be supported by a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If no such discovery is made or confirmed by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a machine learning algorithm correctly predict at least 75% of the medal winners in the 2028 Summer Olympics by the end of the event?

The criteria for a correct prediction are as follows:
- The algorithm must predict the exact medal (gold, silver, or bronze) and the corresponding athlete or team for at least 75% of the total medals awarded.
- Predictions must be made before the start of the Olympics and must be publicly available and time-stamped to verify their authenticity.
- The algorithm's predictions must be documented and published in a verifiable manner, such as on a reputable website or in a peer-reviewed journal.

Verification of the predictions will be based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) at the end of the 2028 Summer Olympics.

In the event of disputes or ambiguities, the resolution will be based on the consensus of at least three reputable sports news organizations (e.g., BBC Sport, ESPN, Reuters).

In the event of conflicting results or lack of consensus, the question will resolve as No.

- Autonomy: The AI system must operate without human intervention during the problem-solving process.
- Complex Molecules: The molecules must be considered complex by the scientific community, typically consisting of at least 20 atoms.
- Validation: The solutions provided by the AI must be validated through peer-reviewed publications or presentations at major scientific conferences. The validation must confirm that the AI's solutions are accurate and reliable.

The question will resolve as Yes upon the publication of the AI's capabilities in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or its presentation at a major scientific conference, with independent verification by experts in the field. In the absence of such publications or presentations, credible reports from at least three major scientific news outlets (e.g., Nature, Science, Scientific American) are sufficient.

An "AI system" refers to any artificial intelligence or machine learning model capable of generating text based on data inputs. 

"Original philosophical theories" are defined as new, substantive contributions to the field of philosophy that are recognized as such by experts in the field. 

"Published in a peer-reviewed journal" means that the theories are accepted and published by an academic journal that employs a peer-review process involving independent experts.

The policy must explicitly mention the use of AI in the context of microbiology and outline regulations, guidelines, or frameworks for its application. 

The enactment must be verified by an official government announcement or publication in the Canada Gazette. 

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (CBC, The Globe and Mail, National Post, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

Temporary or pilot policies do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Canada implement a national AI strategy that includes specific guidelines for microbiology research by December 31, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Canadian government officially implements a national AI strategy that includes specific guidelines or frameworks directly addressing microbiology research. 
The strategy must be publicly accessible and explicitly mention microbiology research in its scope or objectives. 
Confirmation can be through an official government publication or announcement. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (CBC, The Globe and Mail, Toronto Star, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.
The guidelines must be operational and not merely proposed or in draft form. 
If the strategy is part of a broader AI framework, the microbiology research guidelines must be a distinct and integral component.

title: Will India enact a new energy law by December 31, 2028?
body: This question resolves positively if the Indian government enacts a new law specifically addressing energy policy or regulation before December 31, 2028. The resolution source will be official government publications or announcements.

title: Will India enact a new law regulating SpaceX's reusable launch system by December 31, 2028?
body: This question resolves positively if the Indian government enacts a new law specifically regulating the use of SpaceX's reusable launch system before December 31, 2028. The resolution source will be official government publications or announcements.

title: Will a new international law specifically addressing the conduct of the Olympics be enacted before January 1, 2028?
body: This question pertains to the enactment of a new international law that specifically addresses standards, regulations, or guidelines for the conduct of the Olympic Games. The law must be ratified and come into effect before January 1, 2028.

title: Will the Toronto Raptors' franchise value increase by at least 10% before December 31, 2028?
body: This question will resolve positively if Forbes' annual NBA team valuations report indicates that the Toronto Raptors' franchise value has increased by at least 10% compared to the previous year by December 31, 2028.

title: Will any country enact a law specifically addressing the use of machine learning in the healthcare sector before January 1, 2028?
body: The question aims to determine if any country will pass legislation that specifically governs the application of machine learning technologies in healthcare. The law must explicitly mention 'machine learning' and its use in healthcare settings.

title: Will any country pass a law regulating the use of genetically modified organisms (GMOs) in agriculture before January 1, 2028?
body: The question seeks to know if there will be new legislation in any country that specifically regulates the use of genetically modified organisms (GMOs) in agriculture. The law must explicitly mention 'genetically modified organisms' or 'GMOs' and their use in agricultural practices.

title: Will any country implement a national policy mandating the use of renewable energy sources for at least 50% of its energy production before January 1, 2028?
body: The question aims to find out if any country will enact a law or policy that requires at least 50% of its energy production to come from renewable sources such as wind, solar, or hydroelectric power. The policy must be a national mandate and not just a regional or local initiative.

title: Will the 2028 Summer Olympics proceed without any events being canceled due to an outbreak of an infectious disease?
body: This question will resolve positively if no events at the 2028 Summer Olympics are canceled due to an outbreak of an infectious disease. The resolution source will be official announcements from the International Olympic Committee.

title: Will the United Kingdom host a major international sports event before December 31, 2028?
body: This question will resolve positively if the United Kingdom hosts a major international sports event, such as the FIFA World Cup, Rugby World Cup, or the Olympics, before December 31, 2028. The resolution source will be official announcements from the relevant sports governing bodies.

title: Will a resolution addressing climate change be passed by the United Nations General Assembly before January 1, 2028?
body: This question focuses on whether the United Nations General Assembly will pass a resolution specifically addressing climate change, including specific commitments or actions, before January 1, 2028. The resolution must be officially documented and publicly available.

title: Will California pass a new law to significantly reduce carbon emissions by at least 20% from 2020 levels by December 31, 2028?
body: This question pertains to whether the state of California will pass a new law aimed at reducing carbon emissions by at least 20% from 2020 levels. The law must be enacted and documented by the state government and should include specific measures to achieve the reduction target by December 31, 2028.

title: Will a new international treaty on philosophical ethics be signed by at least 10 countries before January 1, 2028?
body: This question asks whether at least 10 countries will sign a new international treaty focused on philosophical ethics. The treaty must be officially documented and available for public review, with signatures from representatives of at least 10 countries, before January 1, 2028.

title: Will Spain's supercomputing capabilities rank in the top 5 of the TOP500 list by June 30, 2028?
body: This question is about whether any supercomputing facility in Spain will be listed among the top 5 in the TOP500 list, which ranks the world's most powerful supercomputers, by the specified date. The resolution will be based on the official TOP500 list released in June 2028.

title: Will a new policy from Microsoft impact the sports and entertainment industry by December 31, 2028?
body: This question resolves positively if Microsoft announces a new policy or initiative that directly affects the sports and entertainment industry before the specified date. The impact must be verifiable through official Microsoft communications or reputable news sources.

body: This question resolves positively if the Canadian government enacts a new national policy specifically addressing data privacy standards for technology companies, including Microsoft, before the end of 2028. The policy must be officially documented and verifiable through government publications.

title: Will Germany pass a new law regulating political advertising on social media platforms by December 31, 2028?
body: This question resolves positively if the German government enacts a new law that specifically regulates political advertising on social media platforms, including those operated by Microsoft, before the end of 2028. title: Will Canada hold a federal election before December 31, 2028?
body: This question resolves positively if Canada holds a federal election before the end of 2028. The election must be officially recognized and verifiable through government publications or reputable news sources.

title: Will Canada enact a new law specifically addressing genetic engineering in humans before January 1, 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Canada enacts a new law that specifically addresses genetic engineering in humans. The law must be formally passed by the Parliament of Canada and receive Royal Assent. The law must explicitly mention genetic engineering or gene editing in the context of human applications. Amendments to existing laws or regulations count towards this question's resolution if they clearly address genetic engineering in humans. Confirmation of the enactment must come from an official government source or be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., CBC, The Globe and Mail, BBC, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Canada pass a new national law on data privacy before January 1, 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Canada enacts a new national law specifically addressing data privacy.

The law must be distinct from any existing legislation and must include significant new provisions or regulations concerning the collection, storage, and/or sharing of personal data.

The enactment of the law must be confirmed through an official announcement by the Government of Canada or publication in the Canada Gazette. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (CBC, The Globe and Mail, Reuters, BBC, New York Times, Washington Post) will be sufficient.

Amendments to existing laws or provincial/territorial laws do not count towards this question's resolution.
